story:
Pre-order Now at Kono Store

Keyboards should do more to help you type. Generic models look cheap, lack modern features, and wear down easily — they’re passive plastic bricks. Your next keyboard should actively work with you to improve speed, performance, and accuracy. It should use AI to augment your typing style, offer per-key analog control in games, and contain the absolute best technology available.

Input Club’s Keystone brings the future to your desk. Comfort, durability, and beauty complement its compatibility with all major operating systems. Keystone will grant you precise control and usher in a new era of keyboarding.

 

  • Full-Size or Tenkeyless physical layout, ANSI-US only
  • SILO Tactile, SILO Linear, and optional Clicky SILO Beam Spring switches
  • NKRO, magnetic (Hall Effect) sensing
  • Per-key HD Analog Control — fine movement in games and apps
  • Adaptive Typing AI — modifies activation point based on your hands
  • Per-key custom RGB lighting and animations
  • Programmable Open Source firmware
  • Optional doubleshot PBT shine-through keycaps in Cherry profile
  • Prototype dimensions (Full-Size): 460mm L x 144mm W x 38mm H
  • Prototype weight: 1500g

The Input Club Keystone Mechanical Keyboard is an unparalleled leap forward in typing and gaming technology. It combines two new features — High Definition Analog Control and per-key Hall Effect (magnetic) sensing — for supreme performance. Put simply, each key can indicate how far it has been pressed down. This pressure sensitivity enables remarkable flexibility in games, artistic programs, and general computing tasks. Its underlying hot-swap SILO switches allow for near-infinite customization, billion-press durability (20x the industry standard), and HD Analog Control for everyone.

Fully programmable Open Source firmware and advanced RGB lighting help the Keystone stand out. We expect this technology stack (and open source adaptations) to show up in all high-quality keyboards over the next few years.

 

 

Hall Effect switches use magnetic field strength to track key movement. This is substantially better than traditional bent-metal contacts in every way. You can adjust how far a key must be pressed to output a letter, sense a key like an analog game controller stick, and gain better overall physical performance (see this technical document from Honeywell, an original patent holder). You can even have an action tied to a half-press or bottom out — anything in between works too!

Low friction Hall Effect switches can last for billions of presses. Their astonishing longevity and smoothness can be traced to one design element: the lack of physical electrical contacts, which continuously degrade in normal switches. Cost, old sensor designs, and lack of innovation kept Hall Effect switches out of modern keyboards until a few months ago. A few vintage keyboards used limited implementations of the tech in mission critical computers, but that’s about it.

 

 

Hot-swappable SILO switches make it easy to change your keyboard’s sound and feel. They’re contactless, so you can pull them out and replace them with different SILO switches at will. There’s no real limit to the number of times you can swap between switches — this is a significant advantage over delicate contact based hot-swap sockets.

 

Linear (Red Slider), Quiet Tactile (Tan Slider), and Clicky Beam Spring (Blue Slider) switches will be available — to see a visual representation of our prototypes’ feel, check out their force curves on Kono’s Keystone page. Please note that we’re targeting light to medium spring resistance numbers; there will be some adjustments. SILO switches support Cherry MX-mount keycaps from all manufacturers. You will configure your Keystone and select your switch on Kono Store after the campaign closes. If you’re not sure which one to get, take a look at this short guide to switch selection.

 

Analog tech offers a better, more feature rich future. Standard keyboards use digital sensing, which results in an ON or OFF signal (1 or 0). Analog technology is more like a gas pedal — it reads every position between those extremes. CAD applications, games involving movement, and drone controls are just a few of the infinite applications of analog technology. Our Open Source firmware means that the Keystone can be adapted to practically any purpose, which is why it’s so groundbreaking.

 

We expect video games to receive the most immediate attention. Console games make heavy use of analog input for variable movement, which hasn’t always translated well to mouse and keyboard setups. Most PC gamers have been stuck with digital input — a fairly unnatural way to play (like a toggle for run, or pressing the W key multiple times to move at less than full speed). The Keystone’s analog switches do away with that jittery movement while outperforming existing analog tech across the board.

 

Artists, creators, and engineers also have an opportunity to engage with HD Analog Control. An API extension would allow brush size changes, variable timeline scrolling speeds, and 3D object control. Analog keyboards will make pressure-sensitive input accessible for the first time, unlocking a new world of human-computer interaction. We’ve created a few powerful use cases, but the most important thing we’re doing with the Keystone is open sourcing its software code so anyone can build on our work.

 

Adaptive Typing AI offers significant comfort improvements for typists. Everyone has different wrist, hand, and finger sizes — even when comparing their own appendages. The Keystone keeps track of how hard and far you tend to press each key using HD Analog Sensing. After a few hundred presses, your keyboard can automatically tweak how far you need to push a key down before sending a signal to your computer.

This accounts for all typing styles, whether you bottom out or float over the keys, and puts less stress on non-central fingers like the pinky. It will also sync well with AI-Driven Autocomplete systems; you could hold a key down to complete a word or sentence once those integrations become more common.

 

 

 

 

Video games allow us to interact with the digital world in ways that delight and amaze us. Unfortunately, interface hardware tends to have frustrating limitations that ruin immersion — the ability to shift your mind into a game’s reality. Analog keyboards remove many of those pain points. Analog keys can control player speed, intuitively stack build options in games like Fortnite, or control stand/crouch/prone positions via a single key. The tech offers so many benefits that digital keyboards will inevitably die out (at least for gamers).  

 

 

 

Artists and creators always struggle with computers. Countless peripherals attempt to address input limitations, but none of them really add value to the base keyboard and mouse system. Tablets and other devices are useful, but macros and hand movements are still a unique mess across most professional software suites.

Input Club creates programmable keyboards, like the Keystone, to ensure that any key can be assigned any function or macro on multiple layers. The Keystone expands those capabilities with analog control. Creating a layer for your program can be useful, but half-hold macros and pressure-sensitive brush sizing (or playhead scrubbing) keys are entirely possible. This simplifies workflow and brings you closer to your end product.

 

Our team of keyboard enthusiasts is dedicated to pushing the keyboard industry forward, and we’ve been doing so for the last 4 years with Kono Store (our distributor). We released and shipped two crowdfunding campaigns — Kira and WhiteFox — which led us to Keystone.

This is the keyboard that we’ve been waiting to make; it’s the reason we formed Input Club. Our work with Kaihua (Kailh), a major switch manufacturer, connected us with the factories, engineering resources, and economies of scale necessary to make Keystone. Analog has always been our moonshot. We finally have enough experience to make a graceful landing.

Much of our keyboard technology is built on the Open Source Keyboard Layout Language (KLL) invented by Jacob Alexander. This software was designed with Analog Sensing in mind. It uses a “Trigger-Release” architecture to send complex signals to your computer. 

Jacob, known throughout the keyboard community as HaaTa, has developed a reputation for having the largest keyboard collection in the world. Analysis of more than 400 historical keyboards led us to the best technologies and design elements from the past, which we then incorporated into Keystone. You can learn more about our team’s character and credentials in the Gizmodo video below:

 

New to the Keystone is a software platform we call HID-IO. HID-IO is a software tool that works like a keyring for your keyboard. You can plug different modules into HID-IO and instantly have a layout optimized for German or French — it will also handle some of the analog communications from Keystone. HID-IO will make it much easier to interface with different games and applications (like Photoshop or AutoCAD) as well. We still have quite a bit of development to go before HID-IO is ready — if you’re interested in contributing, please contact us on our Github Account.

 

Our team intends to make the Keystone as customizable and affordable as possible, so we made certain design choices like an injection molded upper case. The Keystone will come in two size variations: Full Size (Standard) and the shorter Tenkeyless (TKL) that has no number pad. You must select your desired switch — clean linears, smooth tactiles, or (as an add on to one of these options) legendary clicky beam springs — on Kono Store after the campaign closes. (Note: Beam Springs require further life-cycle testing and must be purchased as an add-on.) A voucher and instructions will be sent to your email address once preparations are complete and funding arrives.

 

 

By default, the Keystone will ship with shine-through ABS keycaps. We polled the community before launching the project and received considerable demand for backlit PBT Doubleshot keycaps as an option. Upgrade to a set of these wonderful wear resistant Cherry MX-compatible keycaps for $25 through our backer rewards.

 

The SILO Beam Spring switch deserves several paragraphs of its own — it's our reimagining of a classic clicky mechanism that was used by keyboards in the 1970s. It is highly prized by typists both then and now. Collectors seeking out Beam Spring keyboards for their feel and sound frequently pay over $1000 per keyboard, despite them having unusual layouts and bulky cases. Our challenge was to retain as much of that keyswitch feel as possible while reducing the switch into a much smaller, more modern enclosure. Furthermore, we are also modifying the design to use Hall Effect sensing — no easy feat given the complexity of the mechanism. While we’ve made great strides towards accomplishing this, and even have prototypes, there’s still some work to be done. We need to further refine the keyfeel and perform thorough longevity testing, as the mechanism must be durable.

 

If you would like Beam Spring switches, you must add $39 to your pledge and agree to receive your keyboard with one of the other switch options in February 2020 — SILO Beam switches are expected to arrive in July 2020. We are making some bold claims about the lifespan of our new SILO switches, so we need the additional time to make sure the satisfying click lasts long enough. We are only able to test SILO Beam switches 10 times per second. If we exceed that, the spring doesn’t have enough time to reset to a proper elastic stress position and operates out of spec. We began testing a few months ago, but 1 billion seconds is 31 years, so to get anywhere remotely close to where we need to be will take at least a year.

Beyond the switches, the Keystone is also an incredibly capable keyboard. It is compatible with Windows, Linux, and Mac. It has N-Key Rollover for extremely fast typing, and has perfect latency for gaming and eSports. It's designed to plug in and work out of the box; only its program/game-specific analog features and firmware programming require additional installations. Once your keyboard is set up how you want it, you can move it between computers without losing your settings — everything is stored onboard. The software is Open Source, so if a function isn't present you can request it on Github. Our community of contributing engineers will look it over and may add it to their to-do list.

 

We designed the Keystone case with community customs in mind. On popular forums like /r/mechanicalkeyboards, Geekhack, and the newer keyboard community Keebtalk, aftermarket cases for well designed keyboards are incredibly popular. We wanted to make certain that the Keystone could be easily disassembled and incorporated into enthusiast level products. We will be collaborating with select designers such as Ryan Norbauer to make Keystone technology a driving force behind all of the best mechanical keyboard mods.

Your next keyboard should actively work with you to improve speed, performance, and accuracy. Comfort, durability, and beauty complement its compatibility with all major operating systems. Keystone will grant you precise control and usher in a new era of keyboarding. 
 
 
Full-Size or Tenkeyless physical layout, ANSI-US only
SILO Tactile, SILO Linear, and optional Clicky SILO Beam Spring switches
NKRO, magnetic (Hall Effect) sensing
Per-key HD Analog Control — fine movement in games and apps
Adaptive Typing AI — modifies activation point based on your hands
Per-key custom RGB lighting and animations
Programmable Open Source firmware
Optional doubleshot PBT shine-through keycaps in Cherry profile
Prototype dimensions (Full-Size): 460mm L x 144mm W x 38mm H
Prototype weight: 1500g

 
 The Input Club Keystone Mechanical Keyboard is an unparalleled leap forward in typing and gaming technology. It combines two new features — High Definition Analog Control and per-key Hall Effect (magnetic) sensing — for supreme performance. Put simply, each key can indicate how far it has been pressed down. This pressure sensitivity enables remarkable flexibility in games, artistic programs, and general computing tasks. Its underlying hot-swap SILO switches allow for near-infinite customization, billion-press durability (20x the industry standard), and HD Analog Control for everyone.Fully programmable Open Source firmware and advanced RGB lighting help the Keystone stand out. We expect this technology stack (and open source adaptations) to show up in all high-quality keyboards over the next few years.  
 Hall Effect switches use magnetic field strength to track key movement. This is substantially better than traditional bent-metal contacts in every way. You can adjust how far a key must be pressed to output a letter, sense a key like an analog game controller stick, and gain better overall physical performance (see this technical document from Honeywell, an original patent holder). You can even have an action tied to a half-press or bottom out — anything in between works too!Low friction Hall Effect switches can last for billions of presses. Their astonishing longevity and smoothness can be traced to one design element: the lack of physical electrical contacts, which continuously degrade in normal switches. Cost, old sensor designs, and lack of innovation kept Hall Effect switches out of modern keyboards until a few months ago. A few vintage keyboards used limited implementations of the tech in mission critical computers, but that’s about it.

story:
PicassoTab can be ordered on our website now.

 

Become the next Picasso

Are you an art student who spend an average of 6-8 hours a day sketching and drawing images? Do you strive to keep track of your master pieces scattered among a huge pile of sketch books? How can you share your ideas without carrying your whole art portfolio?

A typical school uses 2000 sheets of paper a day and an art school can easily triple the amount of waste. You know practice makes perfect but you are also worried about the waste you produce and how it could damage the environment. It’s time to go digital.

Getting a digital drawing tablet will solve all the problems said. No more paper sketches, no more carrying of big backpacks and a lot less waste. However, here comes a new problem – a good graphic tablet costs hundreds of dollars. Where to you find the funding as a student?

 

Simbans has a solution for you - PicassoTab. We are creating the world’s first budget Android drawing tablet that is compatible with active pen and has palm rejection.  The light-weight tablet operates on its own and does not require connection with the computer when you draw so there is no need to worry about buying a powerful computer device in addition to paying for the graphic drawing tablet. In addition to its drawing capability, PicassoTab functions like any other Android tablets. You can use it for notes-taking, entertainment, games, photo-taking, presentations and more!

 

--  What is special about Simbans pen? --

 

An active pen is an input device that includes electronic components and allows users to write directly onto the LCD screen surface of a computing device. This means that you will see a cursor on the screen when you hover over the pen on the screen. An active pen is NOT a passive stylus, which only work when actually touching the screen.

Simbans active pen supports 1024 levels of pressure sensitivity, differentiates between pen and finger touch and detects the pen hovering above the display. Moreover, PicassoTab surface has palm rejection feature, i.e. finger/ hand touch will be ignored when the pen is in range.

 

Other Features

Android 7.0 Nougat

Running Android 7.0 Nougat, you can download and install as many games and tools as you want on the PicassoTab. Games like Angry Bird, Minecraft, Sims, and Candy Crush all run smoothly on the tablet with exceptional sound quality.

 

10 Inch IPS HD Display

PicassoTab comes with a 10 inch IPS HD bright display, allowing you to enjoy entertainment with vivid colors from any angle. It aims to maximize your movie-watching (YouTube, Netflix and more!) and gaming experience. Our display technology works well with the built-in 5 megapixel back camera and will help you capture all the important moments of your life.

 

Connect to your social network

You can stay in touch with your friends and family easily by downloading apps such as Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Skype also works perfectly with the built-in microphone and 2 Megapixel front camera.

 

Beautiful Imperishable Gift Box

PicassoTab comes with in beautiful gift box and we offer a Faux leather case in the premium pack! It is easy to clean and will protect your tablet from any scratches and dirt.

 

Technical Details:

Processor: Quad Core MTK8163 1.3GHz/Core
Screen: 10.1 inch tablet. 16:9 capacitive IPS touch screen. Resolution: 1280*800 pixels Screen
Storage: 32 GB disk, can be upgraded with another 32GB of micro-SD card for file storage
RAM: 2GB DDR3
Operating System: Google Android 7 Nougat
Camera: 2.0 M Front Camera and 5.0 Back Camera
Connectivity: WiFi (IEEE802.11b/g/n), Bluetooth and GPS
Applications Google Apps (Gmail, YouTube etc) and Google PLAY (use it to download FREE Games and apps) 
Ports: Ports: Mini-HDMI, USB Type-C, Audio, Micro-SD Card Slot

 

What’s in the BOX: 

1 Tablet PC

1 Screen protector (pre-installed)

1 Simbans Pen

1 Charger with US, UK, Europe Adaptors

1 USB Type-C Cable

1 User Manual

1 Lithium Polymer battery

1 Tablet Case (Faux leather) [For Combos]

 

Timeline

 

FAQ

1. What is special about PicassoTab?

PicassoTab comes with an Active Pen and pre-installed Autodesk Sketchbook app for taking notes or draw diagrams.

2. Can PicassoTab be connected to a 4G network?

No, it cannot be connected to a 4G network and it does not support SIM card. However, it can be connected to Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and GPS.

3. Can I get an up-to-date operating system?

PicassoTab runs Android 7.0 Nougat as the operating system by default. When a new version of Android update file is ready, we will push the update to your tablet.

4. What languages does PicassoTab support?

PicassoTab’s operating system supports all languages provided by Google including English, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Chinese, and Japanese etc.

5. What safety certifications does PicassoTab have?

CE, FCC, RoHS

6. What is the charging port used by Picasso to recharge?

USB Type-C port is used for charging the tablet. It has a more user-friendly design and charge the battery faster than the normal micro-USB ports.

7. What type of battery does Picasso use?

Lithium-ion Polymer.

8. What's the AC input of the charger? Do you provide adapter plugs for different countries?

The AC input is 100V-240V, used internationally. The PicassoTab set comes with adapters for US, UK and Europe standard.

9. What’s the shipping fee?

The shipping cost for each PicassoTab is USD $19 globally. Please note that you may be subject to import taxes, customs duties, and fees (i.e. VAT/GST) etc.

10. Why should I order now?

By backing PicassoTab now you'll get to own one of the most affordable drawing tablet that comes with an active pen for business and leisure purposes. You will also get exclusive access to special offers only available during the Indiegogo campaign.

11. What is your refund policy?

You can get a refund any time before the campaign ends, please follow the steps on How to Request a Refund. As we need to lock orders in to go into production and shipment, we will not be able to offer refunds on orders after they have been shipped.

12. How long is the warranty?

The PicassoTab comes with a 12-month warranty.

13. How do I contact someone?

For your convenience, you can ask questions or leave your feedback on the Simbans Facebook page. You may feel free to send us a message at support@simbans.com too. We will get back to you as soon as we can.

Do you provide adapter plugs for different countries?The AC input is 100V-240V, used internationally. The PicassoTab set comes with adapters for US, UK and Europe standard.9. What’s the shipping fee?The shipping cost for each PicassoTab is USD $19 globally. Please note that you may be subject to import taxes, customs duties, and fees (i.e. VAT/GST) etc.10. Why should I order now?By backing PicassoTab now you'll get to own one of the most affordable drawing tablet that comes with an active pen for business and leisure purposes. You will also get exclusive access to special offers only available during the Indiegogo campaign.11. What is your refund policy?You can get a refund any time before the campaign ends, please follow the steps on How to Request a Refund. As we need to lock orders in to go into production and shipment, we will not be able to offer refunds on orders after they have been shipped.12. How long is the warranty?The PicassoTab comes with a 12-month warranty.13. How do I contact someone?For your convenience, you can ask questions or leave your feedback on the Simbans Facebook page. You may feel free to send us a message at support@simbans.com too. We will get back to you as soon as we can.

story:
Well received by our backers:

What is Horizon?

Traditional rulers do not support digital area measurements and they are not everyday carry products. Horizon has Pixel and Pica sections and it is credit card size to solve these problems. It is a handy tool which feels fantastic in the hand and always gets a reaction from people.

Ultimate smart features such as: Pixel - Pica ruler, inch-cm ruler, protractor, compass and many more.

Put something in your wallet that helps you earn money better, instead of spending better!

A pocket ruler for Digital and Physical designs.

The designer's necessary tool. Unleash creativity.

Eliminate old tools from your life. Be minimal with Horizon.

Special section for Pixel and Pica measurements.

Must have tool for designers. Easily convert your sketches into digital area.

Draw perfect circles with Horizon.

Sketching with Horizon will eliminate a lot of headache in graphic editor tools.

The Horizon is your personal sidekick, its design allows it to be there with you, its flexibility allows to capture that creative moment.

Up to date

Horizon is the only drawing tool with all of the functions below that fits in your wallet on the market. So by backing this project, you will receive a multi-tool ruler unlike any other.

(1) Straightedge X 4 (inch, cm, pixel, pica)
(2) Imperial Compass
(3) Metric Compass
(4) Set square
(5) T-square
(6) Protractor (features 180 degrees with holes at every 10 degrees plus the 45- and 135-degree marks)
(7) Credit Card Size (3 3⁄8 × ​2 1⁄8 inches | 85.60 mm × 53.98 mm)
(8) Laser cut and marked for permanence
(9) TSA secure: There is no sharp edge so you can take Horizon into the plane.


Precision Guaranteed

The four measurement scales that Horizon offers design work both physical and digital. There are 3-inch divisions, 7-centimetre divisions, 16-pica divisions, and a whopping 400-pixel divisions, affording you incredible control over your design work so that maximum precision is always within your grasp.

Flexible and Modern

Horizon offers measurements in pixel and pica. Comfortable to use and highly durable, it is made from stainless steel. This is a ruler engineered with the digital era in mind, so whatever you are designing for, you can be confident that you are prepared.

 

Horizon Memo book is also available.

  • Memo book dimensions are 3-1/2" × 5-1/2" (89mm x 140mm)
  • Plain paper
  • 48 pages
  • Special Edition Horizon Memo Book

Pixels, Not Pixelated!

Simulating a 150 PPI (pixels per inch) length, the pixel measurement side enables you to divide any line up into 10 distinct pixels. Do you want to know how big your design will be within an application? See how all your buttons and design features will line up on the computer before you ever click the mouse!

Easily convert your sketches into digital area.

 

A Modern Solution

We feature picas and pixel measurements in order to give you the options and freedom you need. A typographic unit, the pica is used for – you guessed it! - typography, and one pica is equivalent to a 12-pt font. Using a pica measurement, you can see how the measurements on your screen convert into physical measurements in the real world. What size do you need your font to be? Finally, you can determine this information while you are sketching, even setting up margin, column, and gutter sizes.


Pica is a typographic measuring system.

Sleek and Stylish

It is also fashionable, sure to attract attention your way for all the right reasons. You can do your desk work in an office, on an airplane, or even from the comfort of your home, and feel like you have done everything you need to do to strike an impressive image, Horizon complementing any and all looks.

The compass and protractor holes are designed .05" (1.27mm) width which will fit all your sketching pens and pencils.


The Horizon Ruler is designed to be your tool, its credit card size means it fits in with your life. It’s there when you need it most.


Color Options

To show our appreciation for your generous support, we are offering Horizon at a discount on the retail price exclusively through this crowdfunding campaign, just our way of saying thank you!

 

 

Long-lasting design

Horizon Rulers are made in stainless steel. Stainless steel is estimated to last for 1200 years in a “rule“ environment before heavy pitting. How about prints on the Horizon Rulers? We've spoken to the manufacturer regarding the print and received some more detailed information. The print is going to be silk screened onto the rulers and they are sprayed with an UV protection, to ensure further durability. In their 12 years of operation and manufacturing they haven't had a single case where the print has worn off. After speaking with them we think it is safe to say that the print will be durable!

Sustainable materials

Stainless steel is a green product. It is 100% recyclable, as it is not coated with any toxic material it does not produce toxic run-off.

Shipping

We have warehouses in the following cities:

  • Chicago IL / USA
  • Bratislava / Slovakia
  • Istanbul / Turkey

We will ship your order from our warehouse, where it will be the fastest to deliver to your address.

Any questions?
Always here to help: @horizonruler

Horizon Ruler x INDIEGOGO

Right now, we have come to you, INDIEGOGO, for help raising funds. To show our appreciation for your generous support, we are offering Horizon at a discount on the retail price exclusively through this crowdfunding campaign, just our way of saying thank you!

story:
Using patented MIMICS technology, the Inner Voice app gives individuals with autism the opportunity to speak for themselves.

We Need Your Help!

We've spent years designing, researching and developing MIMICS: mobile interactive mirror neuron-stimulating improvisational cueing system. We're working on developing an advanced prototype, which can be developed into a product, targeted at the millions of people worldwide who have autism. Despite all of our clinical successes with initial prototypes, we now need your help to bring this amazing technology to national and international markets so that larger populations may benefit from this exciting development.

Why We're Doing This

The worldwide market is very robust for apps targeting autism, due to a 289.5% increase in the disorder. In fact, one in 50 children is being diagnosed on the spectrum.  An estimated 40% of individuals diagnosed with autism will be non-verbal and 75%-85% of people on the spectrum will struggle with echolalia or repetitive speech.  The need for cost-effective therapies, apps, and other interventions will continue to grow rapidly worldwide. We believe that creativity, science, and unconventional thinking are keys to providing tools that will improve communication and socialization skills for people on the spectrum. Both of us noticed that the autism app market is filled with conventional products -- most involve touching an icon, which produces speech. 

So we asked a question: what if we could animate images of users so that they could teach themselves how to communicate and interact socially with others? The answer is we can -- and it works!

How Your Contribution Will Help Us

·Create a MIMICS app for multiple platforms and develop a prototype, which features mobile cueing technology

·Obtain Bluetooth and facial recognition software licenses

·Translate InnerVoice for international markets

·Offer the products on Google Play and iTunes

·In exchange for your support, we have a number of unique perks!

Production and Fulfillment Schedule 

In general, developing a brand-new product can take longer than expected, so we’re proposing project milestones listed below. Developing high-quality apps is a time-consuming venture; therefore, we’re proposing a realistic time frame to bring the apps to the market place. We have taken great care to use existing software and other technologies to lower development costs and reduce engineering complexity.

  • November 2013 – Finalize and set features of the app 
  • December 2013 – Product and app testing 
  • January 2014 – Further product testing and certification (FCC and Bluetooth) 
  • February 2014 – Start distributing the first samples of MIMICS to beta testers
  • March 2014 -- Sell app on iTunes and Google Play

Product Details 

By incorporating photograph-based avatars into a conversation, the computer device’s screen could encourage people with autism to attend to faces for social-communicative cues. In fact, current research shows video modeling is an effective tool for teaching people with autism. But MIMICS is different: it features interactive video self-modeling, using animated self-avatars (digital characters which incorporate the user’s face). In our invention, the avatars serve as electronic diplomats – which pique the interest of people with autism and, thus, stimulate dialogue between neurotypical and autistic individuals.

Research and References

We have spent hundreds of hours developing a prototype for InnerVoice and implementing clinical trials with individuals of every age and ability.We have also completed exhaustive research to ensure we have the facts and data to support the concept(s) of InnerVoice.

American Speech-Language-Hearing Association. (2011). Applications (apps) for speech-language pathology practice. Retrieved from

http://www.asha.org/SLP/schools/Applications-for-Speech-Language-Pathology-Practice

American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (1993). Definitions of Communication Disorders and Variations [Relevant Paper]. Available from www.asha.org/policy.

Baron-Cohen, Simon (1995). Mindblindness: An essay on autism and theory of mind. Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press.

Bloom, L & Lahey, M. Language development and language disorders. New York, Wiley, 1978

Blythe A. Corbett, Ph.D., Video Modeling: A Window into the World of Autism, The Behavior Analyst Today, Volume4, No. 3.

Bolte S, Hubl D, Feineis-Matthews S, Prvulovic D, Dierks T, Poustka F. Facial affect recognition training in autism: can we animate the fusiform gyrus? Behav Neurosci 2006; 120: 211–6.

Dunham, G. (2011, April 5). The future at hand: Mobile devices and apps in clinical practice.  ASHA Leader.

Grelotti D, Gauthier I, Schultz RT. Social interest and the development of cortical face specialization: what autism teaches us about face processing.  Dev Psychobiol 2002; 40: 213–25.

Fernandes, B (June 2011) iTherapy: The revolution of Mobile Devices Within the Field of Speech Therapy. Perspectives on School-Based Issues, 12, 35-40.

Kanwisher N, McDermott J, Chun MM. The fusiform face area: a module in human extrastriate cortex specialized for face perception. J Neurosci  1997; 17: 4302–11.

Kanwisher N, Stanley D, Harris A. The fusiform face area is selective for faces not animals. NeuroReport 1999; 10: 183–7.

Kawashima R, Sugiura M, Kato T, Nakamura A, Hatano K, Ito K, et al. The human amygdala plays an important role in gaze monitoring. Brain 1999; 122: 779–83.

Paul, Rhea (2001). Language disorders: From infancythrough adolescence, second edition. St. Louis, MO: Mosby.

Pierce K, Muller RA, Ambrose J, Allen G, Courchesne E. Face processing occurs outside the fusiform ‘face area’ in autism: evidence from functional MRI. Brain 2001; 124: 2059–73.

Pierce K, Haist F, Sedagat F, Courchesne E. The brain response to personally familiar faces in autism: findings of fusiform activity and beyond. Brain 2004; 127: 2703–16.

Prizant, B. M., Wetherby, A. M., Rubin, E., Laurent, A. C., & Rydell, P. J. (2006). The SCERTS Model, Volumes 1&2. Baltimore, MD: Brookes.

Schumann CM, Amaral DG. Stereological analysis of amygdala neuron number in autism. J Neurosci 2006; 26: 7674–9.

Schumann CM, Hamstra J, Goodlin-Jones BL, Lotspeich LJ, Kwon H, Buonocore MH, et al. The amygdala is enlarged in children but not adolescents with autism; the hippocampus is enlarged at all ages.  JNeurosci 2004.

Schumann CM, Barnes CC, Lord C, Courchesne E. (2009) Amygdala enlargement in toddlers with autism related to severity of social and communication impairments. Biol Psychiatry. Nov 15; 66(10):942-9. Epub 2009 Sep 2.

Sennott, S.,& Bowker, A. (2009). Autism, AAC, and Proloquo2Go. Perspectives on Augmentative and Alternative Communication. 18: 137-145.

Risks and challenges

 

We have completed extensive research, conducted clinical trials, and taken careful steps to ensure the success of this project -- while minimizing financial risk. However, as with any project, unforeseen challenges may arise. 

Obtaining desired licenses should not be a challenge, as we have been in contact with companies that offer the needed licenses to complete Inner Voice, and they are excited about using their technology to help individuals with autism. If there is a problem with obtaining licenses, we have identified other sources that can provide us with equivalent technology.

We have contacted developers and graphic artists who have experience developing apps for education and individuals with autism. Should these professionals be unavailable, we have identified developers and graphic artists who are equally skilled.

story:
A $39 titanium pen??

At Polar metals, we've always strived to bring you the best quality titanium products at the best price. Thanks to a drop in processing costs, we can now offer our basic titanium pen for only $39!

This pen is a universal design that can accept 100 types of refills, making sure you always have a refill handy! Beause of the front-loading design, the pen can accept nearly any length refill!

Smooth writing with our included refill.

At Polar Metals, we've successfully funded over $123,000 here on Indiegogo. Join the thousands of others who have backed our Titanium and other exotic metal products!

Full titanium construction ensures this pen will outlast you!

All of the metal on the pen is Grade 5 aerospace titanium.

A minimalist design, a solid cylinder of titanium.

Comfortable and lightweight, the perfect companion for any environment.

Enjoy passing this down as an heirloom through generations.

Ti6AI4V grade 5 aerospace Titanium.

 

Includes a stylish carrying case made from cappuccino PU leather (vegan).

Pledge now and get your own heirloom titanium pen for only $39!

story:
My Week – Magnetic Activity Calendar

Helping your pre-schooler understand the concept of the days of the week and "today" and "tomorrow" can be a challenging task. "My Week - Magnetic Activity Calendar" is designed to help you and your child learn in a fun and interactive way. By involving them in organising their weekly activities and by using bright playful imagery and cartoons, we aim to help your child learn with discovery through doing.

Our fantastic product will:

- Help your child learn about their weekly activities and plan their own week
- Teach them the days of the week
- Help them understand the concept of 'today' and 'tomorrow'

Pack includes:

- Roll out magnetic wall calendar with 20 pre-made activity magnets*
- Includes blank magnet to add your own activity
- Includes dry-wipe pen & cloth

*school/nursery; swimming; gymnastics/tumble-tots; music; park/playground; playgroup/play date; shopping; visiting grandparents; dance; arts & crafts/messy play; at home; story-time; soft play; doctor/dentist appointment; football; martial arts; party; café/restaurant and a blank magnet to add your own activity.

Simply place the appropriate activity magnet on the day that your child will be undertaking that activity. Get your child to help you move the magnets around

Ultimately, we would love to develop a smart phone app to be used in conjunction with the calendar!

Check out the fantastic design we have had done for our calendar packaging. Also, have a look at the wonderful cartoons we have had illustrated for the activity magnets themselves.


(Fancytotz Ltd has filed an application to register the Trademark “My Week”. Copyright of all imagery and designs owned by Fancytotz Ltd)

Who is Fancytotz?

Fancytotz is a unique baby and child product company which sets out to innovate, design and create ingenious solutions to everyday problems.

Set up in early 2013 by two mums, we know how innovative baby product concepts can make parents’ lives easier.

Charlotte Pickering (Founder) is a successful barrister and mum to Ted and Nancy, and Zoe Bermant (Chief Operating Officer) is a global marketing director and mum to Jonah and Abi. They met in 2010 at antenatal classes, remained friends, and then joined forces when they both realised how passionate the other was about building a thriving baby product business.

Fancytotz is currently working on a number of brilliant products which means personal investment has been spread thinly. We see a real demand for this product so want it to be our first concept to bring to market, which is why we are looking for a boost of investment.

What we will use the money for:

- Build a working prototype

- Bulk buy materials to get cheaper deals

- Marketing and PR


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Help us spread the word and make some noise about our campaign
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks and have a good week.

By involving them in organising their weekly activities and by using bright playful imagery and cartoons, we aim to help your child learn with discovery through doing.
Our fantastic product will:
- Help your child learn about their weekly activities and plan their own week- Teach them the days of the week- Help them understand the concept of 'today' and 'tomorrow'Pack includes:
- Roll out magnetic wall calendar with 20 pre-made activity magnets*- Includes blank magnet to add your own activity- Includes dry-wipe pen & cloth*school/nursery; swimming; gymnastics/tumble-tots; music; park/playground; playgroup/play date; shopping; visiting grandparents; dance; arts & crafts/messy play; at home; story-time; soft play; doctor/dentist appointment; football; martial arts; party; café/restaurant and a blank magnet to add your own activity.
Simply place the appropriate activity magnet on the day that your child will be undertaking that activity. Get your child to help you move the magnets around
Ultimately, we would love to develop a smart phone app to be used in conjunction with the calendar!
Check out the fantastic design we have had done for our calendar packaging. Also, have a look at the wonderful cartoons we have had illustrated for the activity magnets themselves.




(Fancytotz Ltd has filed an application to register the Trademark “My Week”. Copyright of all imagery and designs owned by Fancytotz Ltd)

Who is Fancytotz?
Fancytotz is a unique baby and child product company which sets out to
innovate, design and create ingenious solutions to everyday problems.
Set up in early 2013 by two mums, we know how innovative baby product concepts
can make parents’ lives easier.
Charlotte Pickering (Founder) is a
successful barrister and mum to Ted and Nancy, and Zoe Bermant (Chief Operating
Officer) is a global marketing director and mum to Jonah and Abi. They met in
2010 at antenatal classes, remained friends, and then joined forces when they
both realised how passionate the other was about building a thriving baby
product business. 
Fancytotz is currently working on a
number of brilliant products which means personal investment has been spread
thinly. We see a real demand for this product so want it to be our first
concept to bring to market, which is why we are looking for a boost of
investment.


What we will use the
money for:
- Build a working
prototype
- Bulk buy materials
to get cheaper deals
- Marketing and PR







Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Help us spread the word and make some noise about our campaign
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thanks and have a good week.

story:
Hi there!

I'm Jane and I'm a behavior analyst (BCBA). I work with kids with autism and​ other developmental disabilities, using the principles of applied behavior analysis to teach them how to become even better versions of themselves, access their communities, and build meaningful relationships.

In the field of ABA (applied behavior analysis), treatment decisions are driven by data. In order for our clients to receive optimal treatment -  to make growth in the areas of communication, social skills, academics, and overall independence - we spend countless (often unpaid) hours reviewing research, updating goals, creating data sheets, graphing and interpreting session data.

ABAdesk came to be when my significant other, a developer, and I joined forces to solve a problem that many others in my field face - overextending ourselves in order to do right by our clients. I thought, "There must be an easier way to provide optimal treatment; I'd love to put my energy where it belongs - my client interactions."

What We Need & What You Get

ABAdesk has been in development for over a year and is currently in Beta Testing. We are getting closer to launch, but underestimated the cost of being HIPAA compliant. We  are planning to go live by the New Year (January 1st, 2019). As we get our code up to code to ensure that ABAdesk exceeds performance and security standards, we are saving our money and gathering funding to pay for the following:

  • Login Service
  • Personally Identifiable Information (PII) Record Storage 
  • Application Hosting
  • Web Hosting

The sooner we meet our goal, the faster we can get ABAdesk launched!

Here's what makes ABAdesk special:

  • HIPAA Compliant
  • Mobile Friendly
  • Affordable
    • Priced well below comparable services
    • Teachers are eligible for discount
  • Clean & Intuitive Interface
  • Easy to Set Up
    • Any therapist, client, and program creation forms are one page max
  • Minimal Clicking
  • Program Types
    • Frequency
    • Duration
    • Interval Recording
    • Task Analysis
      • Total Task
      • Forward Chaining
      • Backward Chaining
    • Trials
      • 1 Target
      • 1 Set
      • Sequential Targets/Sets
        • Automatically move onto next upon mastery
    • Automatic Transitions To Next Step
      • Phases (baseline, treatment, generalization, maintenance, additional data)
      • Sequential Goals
    • Comprehensive "Data Sheets"
      • Date, Time In & Time Out
      • Data Collection for All Programs & Behaviors
      • Case Note Fields 
      • Questions for Supervisor Field (that get sent to supervisor)
      • Signature Field
      • One click access to program information 
        • Teaching procedures
        • Operational Definitions
        • Non-Examples
        • Antecedent and Consequence Strategies
        • Function of Behavior
        • Replacement Behaviors
        • Mastery Criteria
    • Automatically Generated Graphs
      • View program graphs one at a time, or all at once
    • Program Statistics
      • Session date
      • Phase
      • Therapist
      • Scores
      • Highest prompting level used (if applicable)

    The Impact

    ABAdesk going live will help professionals all over the country make lasting change in the lives of their learners. They'll be able to quickly set up and collect data, and make treatment decisions based on the facts. Additionally, they will save time with program updates, as most of the work is done during the setup process, and automation does the rest!

    Risks & Challenges

    Launching software from the ground up has its challenges. Although we are almost certain we will be ready to launch by January 1st, 2019, and will work our very hardest to meet that deadline, unanticipated hurdles may occur. We will keep you updated every step of the way.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't make a donation, you can still help us meet our goal!

    Share our Indiegogo Campaign with your friends and colleagues, so they can have the opportunity to participate and save big!

     

    Thank you!

story:
Mappsafe is the world's first crowd-sourced mobile app that makes your every journey safer. It reduces violence in public areas by mapping safe & unsafe places. Mappsafe then shares this information with other users and relevant authorities to improve policing & street lighting and increase awareness, your & community safety.


Imagine yourself going to work, traveling abroad or returning home late at night and not worrying if the area you are in is safe or not. 

Everyday millions of people, like you, around the world go through streets and other public places where they feel uncomfortable or unsafe because of poorly lit streets, anti-social behaviour or obscure pathways. Unfortunately there is no easy way to find or share information about these trouble spots. This is where Mappsafe comes in ...

Violence in public places affects everyone. With using Mappsafe you are automatically reducing both the human and economic impact of violence for yourself and others



Also on the drawing board



Expected Delivery date: March 2015



Choose one of these perks & help us make Mappsafe a reality

Perk 1 - Mappsafe Android App ($1): Be a Mappsafe hero! Get the Mappsafe Android App at an early-bird special for just $1. Limited numbers available so hurry and get the app at a discounted price.

Perk 2 - Friend of Mappsafe ($5): Get the Mappsafe Android App and a personal thank you message from the Mappsafe founders. 

Perk 3 - Mappsafe Influencer Individual ($25): Get Perk 2 PLUS your name listed on the Mappsafe website Wall of Fame. Be recognised as a change-maker!

Perk 4 - Mappsafe Influencer Business ($100): Get Perk 2 PLUS your business name and logo listed on the Mappsafe website Wall of Fame. Your business will be visible to a global audience. You will also receive a social media endorsement on our facebook page with back-links to your website.

Note: iPhone users can also contribute by gifting their app to an android user in a developing country.



  1. Contribute:  Select one of the perks and support our crowd-funding campaign.
  2. Promote: Share the Mappsafe Indiegogo campaign page with your social network.
  3. Connect: Join us on Facebook or write a comment on the campaign page. We would love to hear from you.




FAQ


Q. Will Mappsafe work outside Australia?
A. Mappsafe is a global app and can be used anywhere in the world.

Q. Is Mappsafe only available on Android?
A. Yes, at this stage, we are developing the Android app. In near future, we will develop the iphone version as well.

Q. How will I know when the app is ready?
A. We will keep all the contributors updated with our progress on Indiegogo and once the app is ready, we will email you directly about your perk(s).

To learn more, visit www.mappsafe.com CC image by Guilherme Jofili. Mappsafe is a registered trademark of Mappsafe Pty. Ltd.

story:
Summary

Tired of being surveilled for no reason?  So are we! The idea is simple.  Disrupt mass surveillance by creating enormous amounts of data.  Data will be disguised to be indecipherable from actual conversations.  Disruption will occur over all primary forms of communication:

  • Email
  • Phone Calls
  • Text Messaging
  • Web Browsing

The organization will be structured similar to a non-profit.  We are are not here to profit.  Our goal is to disrupt and put an end to the violation of our rights.

What We Need

  • All funding will go towards application development. 
  • If we do not reach our goal funds will go towards developing applications to disrupt at least one communication method.
  • Should ample funds remain they will be used to enhance distribution.
  • Should funds still remain we'll work on enhanced features. Such as playing customizable mp3s during phone calls to maximum resemblance to real phone calls.

What You Get

How this helps you:

  1. If using our app you'll have plausible deniability because you'll have a huge number of unknown contacts and conversations.
  2. Privacy through disinformation.  Your actual interests, contacts, etc will be mixed in with things your not interested in and people you don't know.
  3. Unknown relationship map.  It'll be much more difficult for those surveilling you to establish relational maps of your contacts.
  4. The assurance that your contributing towards the fundamental human right of privacy.

Summary of Perks:

  • $25 - Surveillance Distribution Network Bumper Sticker
  • $100 - Limited Edition SDN T-Shirt
  • $1,000 - Provide input and help us design a logo.  All lower tiers
  • $10,000 - BETA Testing and all lower tiers
  • $50,000 - Assist and provide input on development

The Impact

Hopefully we'll disrupt surveillance to the point that mass global surveillance will come to an end.  At a bare minimum we hope to raise awareness about mass surveillance and decrease the effectiveness of mass surveillance.


How it Works - The Tech - *Warning* Detailed explanation for the curious

We envision this functioning similar to torrents.  Users will connect to a "Disruption" file that simply connects them to peers also on the SDN network.  Before connecting the user will configure client settings.  Their client settings will include which resources to use (i.e. SMS, Phone Calls, Web Browsing, or Email) and when to use them (i.e. Voice only during nights and weekends when its likely free).

After setting user preferences and connecting to peers the program will begin to communicate with users.  Communication will take place automatically with peers on the network they've connected to.  Communication will only use protocols specified users by the user, during times specified by the user.

The program will automatically communicate unless disrupted by the user.  Devices will randomly cycle between communications methods specified by the user.

Phone:

Smart phone required. Phone calls will automatically be made to users within the same country (to avoid long distance) using an auto-dialer and auto-answerer.  The phone (mobile smart phone only) will continually call other phone numbers connected to the disruption network they are connected to.  Other phones on the network will answer incoming calls from other users automatically.  Calls will stay connected for a random amount of time then disconnect and repeat the process with another user or switch to another communication method.  The application will automatically disable sound on SDN contacts so the application can run overnight without disrupting our sleep!

Text Messaging / SMS :

Smart phone required. Text messages will randomly be sent to other users connected to the disruption network.  Your phone will also receive text messages from other users on the network.  Hundreds upon hundreds of text messages can be sent in a short amount of time to hundreds of peoples.  Text message content will randomly cycle through internet content or user specified dictionary files.  

Email:

Emails will randomly be sent to and received from other users on the SDN network.  Email content will be generated through current events and/or dictionary files.  Our application will automatically delete or file these emails so your Inbox isn't filled with thousands of Disruption emails!  The nature of emails would allow us to send thousands of text messages a day without disrupting your normal email use.  Normal emails would be difficult if not impossible to determine amongst thousands of disruption emails.


Email:

Emails will randomly be sent to and received from other users on the SDN network.  Email content will be generated through current events and/or dictionary files.  Our application will automatically delete or file these emails so your Inbox isn't filled with thousands of Disruption emails!  The nature of emails would allow us to send thousands of text messages a day without disrupting your normal email use.  Normal emails would be difficult if not impossible to determine amongst thousands of disruption emails.


Web Browsing:

An application on your smart phone or computer will continually browse the internet.  Sites can be browsed at random or based on a dictionary file.  This would make it incredibly difficult to determine which websites you were actually visiting.  It would also make it difficult to determine when you are actively using the internet since SDN could always be browsing the internet.  The dictionary file could be used to mislead big brother on your interests.  What if you loaded a dictionary with fishing terms and SDN randomly went to fishing websites.  Big Brother would automatically think your a fisherman.  Or are you?


Other Ways You Can Help

Communicate as much as possible with as many people as possible!!  Vote against supporters of the NSA and GCHQ.  Vote for the estoration of our basic human rights.

story:
Who we are:

We are social butterflies.  We are extreme networkers.  We love coffee, and we love connecting.  But at social networking events or conventions, finding the professionals we actually want to meet can be very difficult -- near impossible.  We waste too much time walking around and reading random name tags!  We want people who can help us reach our goals -- but in a room of thousand others -- how do we find them?  

The CuCme solution:

Introducing "CuCme" -- a new mobile application that will help people "See" others -- so we can spend less time looking for connections, and more time actually building them.


 CuCme Features:

  • Free to download!
  • "Push to be Visible"!  Choose to broadcast your Business profile, your Personal profile, or both
  • Select what business and personal information you want to share
    • Name, Company, Email, Phone, Photo, Needs & Interests, Location
    • Import LinkedIn and Facebook information
  • Build your bio and profile; upload your most dashing self-portrait!
  • Browse other profiles and build your network
  • Check out the Map View for people located near you -- friends you know, and new people of interest
  • How do you want to be contacted?  Integrated with your phone's calling, email, and text functions
  • Premium subscription ($5 per month, $60 per year) will offer additional features, fields, and search options

Distribution:

We are working to build partnerships with conferences and events -- where CuCme's features can really be maximized.

Technology:

  • iOS & Android
  • GPS & Bluetooth for geolocation
  • MySQL DB

What We Need & What You Get:

Building and distributing a mobile app is quite the challenge, so we could really use your support!  Your generous donations will help us:  

  • Engage a team of app developers, designers, researchers, and engineers to make CuCme as user-friendly and tech-savvy as possible  
  • Get the leverage we need to partner with major conventions and networking events
  • Shoulder promotion and advertising costs  
  • Make the CuCme service a public service -- at no cost to the professionals, coffee-drinkers, and casual networkers everywhere 

Other Ways You Can Help

What we need most is your support.  Another great way to help the CuCme project is by simply getting the word out!

  • Shout us out on Twitter! #CuCme
  • Click on our share tools here to quickly share our message on Facebook
  • Promote the app at your next event, convention, or public gathering

 

Additional "Perks" Information:

 

 

 

The Private Neworking Event will be in New York, and
centered around the dates for the Clinton Global Initiative.  
This event historically occurs in September of each year. 

 

The historic 21 Club in New York will be the location
for the East Coast Private Networking Event.  

 

 

 

The world famous Spago in Beverly Hills will be the
location for the West Coast Private Networking Event.  

 

 

Your round of golf will be played in a foursome at one of
the many famous Golf Clubs in and around Los Angeles.

story:
What is SQUIZZ?

           

It's the easiest digital media display system ever invented!

(And we'll prove it...before you fund it!)  

After more than a year of daily use, in dozens of businesses, we've proven that SQUIZZ is the easiest digital signage system ever invented. That was our goal and now we have two new goals. Share it with the world and make it even better. With your help we can spread the word and continue to develop new features and capabilities. You're going to love how easy SQUIZZ is to use. In fact, we're going let you see how easy it is right here on Indiegogo..... before you fund it!

           THE SQUIZZ SYSTEM

The SQUIZZ system uses an Android stick loaded with the Squizz App. Slightly bigger than a flash drive, The Squizz Stick plugs into any TV with an HDMI port. Once connected to WI-FI, it's ready to display HD quality images, videos and documents immediately!  It's easy to install, light, portable and runs continuously!         

 SQUIZZ's Cloud-Based Content Manager is the key to it's simplicity. Accessible from any device, the drag-and-drop interface does everything. Upload any file and SQUIZZ makes it work. We want you to see how simple it really is. (See Below)


                     TAKE THE CONTENT MANAGER FOR A TEST DRIVE!

There are very few products, if any, on Indiegogo that provide the opportunity to try it before you fund it.  We are so confident you'll love the simplicity of Squizz, we're going to do give you that opportunity. 

                                          The Squizz Uploader Window

Just click on the words SQUIZZ LIVE DEMO.  
Once you get logged in, stay logged in until your are finished playing with the
demo. Then come back to Indiegogo and learn how you can help.
The Squizz Monitor / Timeline 

     

In the beginning...

SQUIZZ was created by Chris Oar. Aussie by birth, Chris has been a marketing and advertising consultant in the Bay Area for over 20 years.  When researching a digital signage systems for a client, he discovered they were all complicated and expensive!  You needed special hardware, custom installation and then you had to learn how to use software that was limited as to what content you could create. That's when he came up with the idea for SQUIZZ.  

Chris hired the development team at GetBoundless, to create the Squizz App.  It was designed to work on any Android device which means the need for expensive hardware and custom installation were eliminated. Next the team developed a cloud based content management software that could convert almost any type of video, image or document file for use as digital sign content.  

The first SQUIZZ prototype was put into service in late 2013.  SQUIZZ has been proven under daily use since then. Right now we are developing an enhanced version of the system called SQUIZZ Pro and preparing for a large scale roll-out of both products. There are so many ways to use SQUIZZ, in almost any business and even at home, we're sure you're going to want one! 


Who is using SQUIZZ? 

According to a report published in May 2015, the world-wide digital signage market is nearly $15 Billion, but it's expected to grow to almost $24 billion in just the next five years!  It's clear that delivering information through visual media display is going to play an important role in everyone's daily lives. 

                                                                       

What role will Squizz play in the future of digital signage?

SQUIZZ turned to crowd-funding to grow because we believe the future for Squizz is to become an open source platform for developing digital signage concepts. 

Like so many great innovations before, opening the door for developers and designers to improve what we've started will make Squizz exponentially greater than it is today. That's why part of the funds from our Indiegogo campaign will go towards developing the Squizz Pro platform.   Squizz Pro will be designed so that third party contributions can be integrated as easily as downloading a new widget, graphic design template or video and dropping it in the content manager. 
YOUR FUNDING ON INDIEGOGO WILL HELP SQUIZZ DEVELOP THE SQUIZZ PRO PLATFORM AND BEGIN THAT FIRST STEP TOWARDS GREATER INNOVATION. 
          

              What We Need From You

We are hoping to raise $250,000 to fund several objectives.
What will the funds be use for?

  • Bulk buy of SQUIZZ Sticks from manufacturer. To date, we have only purchased the SQUIZZ Sticks or dongles in small quantities. Then we have to "re-manufacture" them by redesigning the firmware, loading the SQUIZZ App then custom labeling and packaging each stick, one at a time. With your funding, we can make a large enough order to have the manufacturer use our specs, load the SQUIZZ app and do all labeling and packaging, driving down the costs and speeding up delivery. You can help make SQUIZZ even more affordable!
  • Development of SQUIZZ Pro. Squizz Pro will be the platform of the future, but it needs more development first. Your funding will help us develop coding that will accept feature widgets and plugins as easily as a mouse click.   "SQUIZZIDGETS" could be used to add useful content to a sign like date, time, weather, web content and more!  Other new features we are developing for Squizz Pro include setting Start & End times for timelines and re-directing timelines from one monitor to another. 
  • Marketing/Advertising. With your funding, we can grow our internet presence and open new marketing channels to bring offer SQUIZZ to more people.  
  • SQUIZZ Community Development: Finally, we need to grow our online SQUIZZ Community/Marketplace where users and developers can exchange ideas, sell content templates, download widgets and more.   

YOUR FUNDING CAN MAKE THIS HAPPEN. PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD AND THANKS FOR FUNDING SQUIZZ! 

   

PERKS!   PERKS!   PERKS!

The first level of funding is a $10 donation to help our project move forward. We can't offer much, but our thanks will be heartfelt. Your perk will be a coupon that can be used within a years time to receive a 25% discount off the purchase of a complete Squizz Digital Signage system. 
THE NEXT LEVEL, TRUE BLUE, INCLUDES THE COUPON, PLUS....

THE NEXT LEVEL, RIPPER, INCLUDES THE COUPON, THE GLASSES AND...

THE REMAINING PERKS ARE EXCLUSIVE OFFERS THAT ARE ONLY AVAILABLE THROUGH INDIEGOGO.  ALL PRICING REPRESENTS SUBSTANTIAL DISCOUNTS FROM OUR NORMAL RETAIL PRICING AND WILL ONLY BE AVAILABLE DURING THE FIRST PHASE OF THE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN.  SOME OFFERS ARE LIMITED IN QUANTITY AND ARE AVAILABLE ONLY WHILE SUPPLIES LAST. 

  

 

THE ENTREPRENEUR PACKAGE

$10,000

If you own an ad agency, radio station, graphic design company, video production company or, if your business has vendors that will pay for impressions in your store, like a mall, grocery store or other high traffic business, this investment in SQUIZZ will pay for itself many times over.  SQUIZZ is serious about helping you make it happen.  How serious?  Not only will you receive everything in the Franchise Package above, we'll also come to your location for three day launch campaign to help start your SQUIZZ business.  If you're interested in this contribution level, contact us  before you fund and we will provide additional information.  We'll show you how to build substantial revenue as a SQUIZZ-trepreneur. 
To help launch the product and your business, we'll bring world famous hypnotist and motivational speaker Mark Yuzik to entertain your guests at the SQUIZZ launch party.


     
So what do you think?  Are you ready to Squizz?

story:
Gather is a modular home for your essentials, thoughtfully designed to help you cut through the clutter.

Clutter. You don't want to think about it, but it always creeps in over time, making it impossible to find things when you actually need them.

As a designer, I spend most of the day working at my desk and reach for the same things over and over.

I try to stay organized, but by the end of the day my desk is a complete, cluttered mess because there's no central place to put everything.

I searched for a product to solve this problem, but all I found were ugly, cheaply-made organizers.

What I wanted was a beautifully-designed, minimal organizer. Something to gather all of my essentials into one central place.

So I designed Gather.

Gather adapts to your workspace and workflow to make sure the tools you need are always within reach.

Use it your way

Gather can be configured in hundreds of ways to exactly the way you want to use it.

The grid system allows each of the pieces to be rotated or positioned anywhere along the base.

The magnets embedded in the base allow you to attach additional pieces.

The pieces can be attached to either the side or the back of the base.

You can even combine two full sets to create a much larger organizer.

Stay organized without thinking about it.

Gather cuts the clutter of small desk items, acts as a central home base for your most used items, and keeps everything neatly in place.

The phone holder keeps your phone propped up so you don't have to hunch over your desk.

The phone holder is designed to hold any phone with or without a case.

Gather works great for organizing so many other spaces as well.

Spend more time creating

 

Gather’s minimal form factor eliminates the time you spend digging through a messy drawer for your essentials.

Your tools are always within reach.

 

 

Make your workspace beautiful

Gather is made with beautiful solid wood and polished white thermoplastic. 

 

Durable, high-quality materials with precision craftsmanship mean that this organizer complements any space and will stand the test of the time.

 

Every Detail Considered

Gather may look simple from the outside, but I’ve put a ton of thought and engineering into every little detail. It's the perfect marriage of form and function. Even the packaging has been carefully designed with little details like a magnetic closure on the box. 

 

2 Color Options

Gather is available in 2 colors: Walnut or Maple. Each base is milled from solid wood and then sanded and polished to a super smooth finish.

Details & Specs

 

Win the never-ending battle against clutter

Even though I like to stay organized, my desk would always end up cluttered by the end of the day because there was no central place to put everything.

I searched for a product that would help me solve this problem, but all I found were ugly, cheaply-made organizers. What I wanted was a beautifully-designed, minimal organizer that could gather all of my essentials into one central place.

 

 

So I decided to design one myself.

For the past 3 years, I’ve worked through dozens of prototypes and sketches to dial in every detail.

I went from chopping up rough foam models with a pocket knife all the way to working with industrial design engineers to produce 3D-models and technical drawings that are ready for mass manufacturing.

Ugmonk has shipped tens of thousands of products to over 65 countries around the world and provided over 70,000 meals to children in need through their partnership with Rice Bowls.

Visit Ugmonk.com to learn more.

 

                                                                                                                       

 

 

My desk is kinda famous too :)

Photos of my workspace have been downloaded over 1.5 million times and featured on sites all over the web. You may have even seen them floating around somewhere.

 

 

We've been featured on:

 

For any questions or press inquiries feel free to email us at gather@ugmonk.com.

  Win the never-ending battle against clutter
Even though I like to stay organized, my desk would always end up cluttered by the end of the day because there was no central place to put everything.
I searched for a product that would help me solve this problem, but all I found were ugly, cheaply-made organizers. What I wanted was a beautifully-designed, minimal organizer that could gather all of my essentials into one central place.

 

 
 
I searched for a well-designed minimalist organizer, but all I found were ugly, cheaply made products that didn’t function the way that I wanted and didn’t match the clean aesthetic of my workspace.
So I decided to design one myself.
For the past 3 years, I’ve worked through dozens of prototypes and sketches to dial in every detail.
I went from chopping up rough foam models with a pocket knife all the way to working with industrial design engineers to produce 3D-models and technical drawings that are ready for mass manufacturing.



Jeff Sheldon is the founder and designer of Ugmonk, a brand focused on creating high quality, well-designed products. What started as a small side project to create and sell simple t-shirts has grown into a full-blown lifestyle brand which Jeff now runs full time.
Ugmonk has shipped tens of thousands of products to over 65 countries around the world and provided over 70,000 meals to children in need through their partnership with Rice Bowls.
Visit Ugmonk.com to learn more.

 
Jeff Sheldon, Founder and Designer of Ugmonk
 Ugmonk.com
                                                                                                                       
 

 
My desk is kinda famous too :)
Photos of my workspace have been downloaded over 1.5 million times and featured on sites all over the web. You may have even seen them floating around somewhere.
This photo of my desk has been viewed by millions of people!
 

 
 
My workspace where I spend my days running Ugmonk
