For any questions or press inquiries feel free to email us at gather@ugmonk.com.

story:
WATT, OTTO, DIESEL, WHITTEL …. THE CFRV ENGINE

OUR PROJECT

Hi, I’m Dr. Roy Hartfield, professor of aerospace engineering at a major research university and the head of the CFRV Engine Project team. Our team is doing something that’s been described as “ridiculously ambitious”, yet many of the same people who first had that reaction have joined us because they believe these efforts are nothing short of an attempt to substantially improve the course of the world’s environmental and economic wellbeing. Believe me, you want us to succeed, and we need your help.

About ten years ago I had an idea for a greatly improved engine. Gas and diesel engines have, and will continue to suffer poor emissions and efficiency because of the wreckage left behind from intermittent combustion “explosions” in the pistons. Continuous combustion gas turbines, while highly efficient and clean (that’s why they produce over 20% of all electricity) can’t operate at slow speeds. They only perform well when running at near full throttle. This is why airline jets burn almost as much fuel taxiing to the runway as they do at altitude and full speed. Plus, they’re darned expensive to build.

There are many barriers to producing a truly efficient, useful internal combustion engine. Some of these are combustion control, emissions, wide operating range, fuel efficiency, mechanical efficiency, production costs, size, weight and longevity. Many people have tried many things. Our engine design over-comes most of the operational issues found in piston and gas turbine designs. Theoretically, the design promises an almost 50% increase in efficiency over gasoline piston designs and an even greater proportional decrease in emissions. All in a package that will be comparable in manufacturing cost to a piston or gas turbine engine of similar horse power. There are numerous other subtle advantages. Our design is called a continuous flow rotary vane (CFRV) design and while there are some earlier attempts at somewhat similar designs, this design incorporates entirely new concepts. The design has patents issued and pending.

 

Engine Cycle Engine Schematic

Click here for more pictures.

See video for animation of engine operation.

WHAT WE DID THAT’S REALLY DIFFERENT.

The design is based on continuous, separate combustion in a positive displacement environment. This key innovation provides:

  • Combustion control resulting in 99% complete combustion
  • No throttling needed for proper fuel/air mixture for intermittent (piston) combustion designs
  • Low emissions without after treatment due to longer and leaner combustion
  • Low mechanical losses and smooth operation due to the rotary vane compressor and expander
  • Flexible fuels, including low BTU fuels, just like gas turbines
  • Low cost manufacturing; no exotic shapes or materials

For more technical details please see our website www.hartfieldtechnology.com

FAQs

Explain how the engine solves the piston and turbine engine issues.

Will it have expensive component issues like a gas turbine?

Will this fit in a car?

How do you lubricate the engine?

What are those tubes in the engine?

What are the specifications of the prototype engine shown?

What's the thermodynamic cycle?

 

After five years of design refinement, I personally funded the patents and manufacture of a test bed prototype beginning in 2008. A working prototype was built by 2010 and it proved many of the design concepts, but the seals for the engine were not manufactured with the precision needed. In short, they leak, and until that’s dealt with the engine can never achieve the efficiencies promised. Additionally, we ran out of funds needed to properly test the gas turbine-like combustor.

Sealing and lubricating a variable volume chamber like the CFRV can be done, as proven by Mazda/Wankel and the millions of rotary engines it produced. The Wankel engine’s shortcomings are not seals and lubrication but rather fuel efficiency and emissions. Just like all other intermittent combustion designs. Over the last 18 months our team has interviewed and consulted with numerous seal and lubrication experts across the country and has devised a plan. This can be done, just not by a standard machine shop. And that’s where we need your help.

You’re probably wondering that if the design is so revolutionary why then hasn’t a team with substantial government and industry work history gotten the backing from the likes of the U.S. DoD or DoE, or GM. For over 3 years we’ve been pursuing research funding through SBIR programs, only to be told funding had been cut or was only available to existing projects. The technical reviewers were very complimentary and found no technical faults. (Click here for some of the review comments) We’ve had investor types make offers too, but at a substantial cost and loss of control. So far, we’ve been able to maintain creative control of the project, and we strive to continue to do so. Also, to be clear, we did not seek, nor does the project have, any affiliation with Auburn University. At the urging of students and colleagues we are pursuing crowd funding. We simply can’t wait any longer.

That’s why we’re here on IndieGoGo.

WHAT WE’RE GOING TO DO WITH YOUR HELP.

The ultimate goal of the IndieGoGo project is to operate the test bed prototype engine on natural gas at a load sufficient to determine final efficiency. After that we realize we’ll need serious, multimillion-dollar efforts to see this through to commercialization. But one step at a time. After that, rest assured, once we get the proof, we’ll beat down the doors of the industry.

The project will entail rebuilding the three sets of seals using new manufacturing techniques and materials, refinishing the compression and expansion chamber and test firing the combustor to full design power. All seals will be statically and dynamically tested prior to engine final assembly.All supporters will be invited to join a private web cast of the testing. Some will even be invited to attend the event in person. This promises to be very exciting; history in the making, so to speak.

How will the proceeds be used?

The budget for the project was constructed from quotes from the seal engineering and manufacturing experts and individuals who will be directly involved in the combustor tests. These entities will receive the funds. Sounds simple, but as the first attempt showed, this is a job that requires decades of experience to do correctly. No funds will be used for team salaries or personal expenses. To meet the project's goal of a successful operation of the test bed engine, the seals and all seal surfaces must be remanufactured and tested. To test the combustor numerous test fixtures must be produced in addition to substantial instrumentation to document the firing. The Team believes that $95,000 (minus the campaign fees, approx.. $85,000) will allow us to:

  • Finalize the improved seal design
  • Rebuild, polish and test the three different sets of seals
  • Rebuild and polish the vanes
  • Rebuild and polish the rotor vane “wedges”
  • Refinish the surface of the compressor and expander chamber
  • Perform static and dynamic testing of the seals
  • Build combustor test stand and instruments
  • Perform partial and full power testing of the combustor
  • Perform partial and full power testing of the test bed prototype

The Team

Dr. Roy Hartfield – Woltosz Professor of Aerospace Engineering, Auburn University (Auburn University is not involved with the CFRV engine project)(resume)

Dr. Rhonald Jenkins – Professor Emeritus - Department of Aerospace Engineering, Auburn University

Dr. David Scarborough – Combustor Design and Testing

Harold McCormick – Seals and Tribology (on contract basis)

John K Collings – Project Management

The fun part... What will it sound like? Rumble, or roar?

This engine is different. It has positive displacement like a piston, yet continuous combustion like a turbine. So what will it sound like? We have some interesting wagers inside the team on this subject. The loud “wump, wump, wump” you hear from muscle cars and Harleys is the sound of pressure bursting from the cylinders when the exhaust valves open. The same goes for the roar of a jet engine. This is unused pressure that performed no work; lost energy, wasted fuel. The CFRV expands this pressure almost down to atmospheric so there’ll be no “wump”, but rather a continuous stream of exhaust. As the goal of the project is to live fire the engine we’ll know soon enough, but what do you think? Let us know your thoughts.

HELP US BUILD A BETTER WORLD.

Why should you help? Because while renewable energy sourcesare being perfected, combustion engines will continue to be used for many decades. But they can be used better, more effectively and with much less pollution. This design isn’t just smaller, cheaper and more powerful. It isn’t some interesting science project. It encompasses all the requisite attributes to make it into mass production and in the process actually make the world a better, cleaner, safer place to be. We’re proud of these goals. Why help? We’re going to make a difference. You can too.

Please help us, any way you can.
story_txt:
WATT, OTTO, DIESEL, WHITTEL …. THE CFRV ENGINE
OUR PROJECT
Hi, I’m Dr. Roy Hartfield, professor of aerospace engineering at a major research university and the head of the CFRV Engine Project team. Our team is doing something that’s been described as “ridiculously ambitious”, yet many of the same people who first had that reaction have joined us because they believe these efforts are nothing short of an attempt to substantially improve the course of the world’s environmental and economic wellbeing. Believe me, you want us to succeed, and we need your help.
About ten years ago I had an idea for a greatly improved engine. Gas and diesel engines have, and will continue to suffer poor emissions and efficiency because of the wreckage left behind from intermittent combustion “explosions” in the pistons. Continuous combustion gas turbines, while highly efficient and clean (that’s why they produce over 20% of all electricity) can’t operate at slow speeds. They only perform well when running at near full throttle. This is why airline jets burn almost as much fuel taxiing to the runway as they do at altitude and full speed. Plus, they’re darned expensive to build.
There are many barriers to producing a truly efficient, useful internal combustion engine. Some of these are combustion control, emissions, wide operating range, fuel efficiency, mechanical efficiency, production costs, size, weight and longevity. Many people have tried many things. Our engine design over-comes most of the operational issues found in piston and gas turbine designs. Theoretically, the design promises an almost 50% increase in efficiency over gasoline piston designs and an even greater proportional decrease in emissions. All in a package that will be comparable in manufacturing cost to a piston or gas turbine engine of similar horse power. There are numerous other subtle advantages. Our design is called a continuous flow rotary vane (CFRV) design and while there are some earlier attempts at somewhat similar designs, this design incorporates entirely new concepts. The design has patents issued and pending.
 
Engine Cycle Engine Schematic
Click here for more pictures.
See video for animation of engine operation.
WHAT WE DID THAT’S REALLY DIFFERENT. 
The design is based on continuous, separate combustion in a positive displacement environment. This key innovation provides:

Combustion control resulting in 99% complete combustion
No throttling needed for proper fuel/air mixture for intermittent (piston) combustion designs
Low emissions without after treatment due to longer and leaner combustion
Low mechanical losses and smooth operation due to the rotary vane compressor and expander
Flexible fuels, including low BTU fuels, just like gas turbines
Low cost manufacturing; no exotic shapes or materials

For more technical details please see our website www.hartfieldtechnology.com
FAQs
Explain how the engine solves the piston and turbine engine issues.
Will it have expensive component issues like a gas turbine?
Will this fit in a car?
How do you lubricate the engine?
What are those tubes in the engine?
What are the specifications of the prototype engine shown?
What's the thermodynamic cycle?
 
After five years of design refinement, I personally funded the patents and manufacture of a test bed prototype beginning in 2008. A working prototype was built by 2010 and it proved many of the design concepts, but the seals for the engine were not manufactured with the precision needed. In short, they leak, and until that’s dealt with the engine can never achieve the efficiencies promised. Additionally, we ran out of funds needed to properly test the gas turbine-like combustor.
Sealing and lubricating a variable volume chamber like the CFRV can be done, as proven by Mazda/Wankel and the millions of rotary engines it produced. The Wankel engine’s shortcomings are not seals and lubrication but rather fuel efficiency and emissions. Just like all other intermittent combustion designs. Over the last 18 months our team has interviewed and consulted with numerous seal and lubrication experts across the country and has devised a plan. This can be done, just not by a standard machine shop. And that’s where we need your help.
You’re probably wondering that if the design is so revolutionary why then hasn’t a team with substantial government and industry work history gotten the backing from the likes of the U.S. DoD or DoE, or GM. For over 3 years we’ve been pursuing research funding through SBIR programs, only to be told funding had been cut or was only available to existing projects. The technical reviewers were very complimentary and found no technical faults. (Click here for some of the review comments) We’ve had investor types make offers too, but at a substantial cost and loss of control. So far, we’ve been able to maintain creative control of the project, and we strive to continue to do so. Also, to be clear, we did not seek, nor does the project have, any affiliation with Auburn University. At the urging of students and colleagues we are pursuing crowd funding. We simply can’t wait any longer.
That’s why we’re here on IndieGoGo.
WHAT WE’RE GOING TO DO WITH YOUR HELP. 
The ultimate goal of the IndieGoGo project is to operate the test bed prototype engine on natural gas at a load sufficient to determine final efficiency. After that we realize we’ll need serious, multimillion-dollar efforts to see this through to commercialization. But one step at a time. After that, rest assured, once we get the proof, we’ll beat down the doors of the industry.
The project will entail rebuilding the three sets of seals using new manufacturing techniques and materials, refinishing the compression and expansion chamber and test firing the combustor to full design power. All seals will be statically and dynamically tested prior to engine final assembly.All supporters will be invited to join a private web cast of the testing. Some will even be invited to attend the event in person. This promises to be very exciting; history in the making, so to speak.
How will the proceeds be used?
The budget for the project was constructed from quotes from the seal engineering and manufacturing experts and individuals who will be directly involved in the combustor tests. These entities will receive the funds. Sounds simple, but as the first attempt showed, this is a job that requires decades of experience to do correctly. No funds will be used for team salaries or personal expenses. To meet the project's goal of a successful operation of the test bed engine, the seals and all seal surfaces must be remanufactured and tested. To test the combustor numerous test fixtures must be produced in addition to substantial instrumentation to document the firing. The Team believes that $95,000 (minus the campaign fees, approx.. $85,000) will allow us to:

Finalize the improved seal design
Rebuild, polish and test the three different sets of seals
Rebuild and polish the vanes
Rebuild and polish the rotor vane “wedges”
Refinish the surface of the compressor and expander chamber
Perform static and dynamic testing of the seals
Build combustor test stand and instruments
Perform partial and full power testing of the combustor
Perform partial and full power testing of the test bed prototype

The Team
Dr. Roy Hartfield – Woltosz Professor of Aerospace Engineering, Auburn University (Auburn University is not involved with the CFRV engine project)(resume)
Dr. Rhonald Jenkins – Professor Emeritus - Department of Aerospace Engineering, Auburn University
Dr. David Scarborough – Combustor Design and Testing
Harold McCormick – Seals and Tribology (on contract basis)
John K Collings – Project Management
The fun part... What will it sound like? Rumble, or roar?
This engine is different. It has positive displacement like a piston, yet continuous combustion like a turbine. So what will it sound like? We have some interesting wagers inside the team on this subject. The loud “wump, wump, wump” you hear from muscle cars and Harleys is the sound of pressure bursting from the cylinders when the exhaust valves open. The same goes for the roar of a jet engine. This is unused pressure that performed no work; lost energy, wasted fuel. The CFRV expands this pressure almost down to atmospheric so there’ll be no “wump”, but rather a continuous stream of exhaust. As the goal of the project is to live fire the engine we’ll know soon enough, but what do you think? Let us know your thoughts.
HELP US BUILD A BETTER WORLD.
Why should you help? Because while renewable energy sourcesare being perfected, combustion engines will continue to be used for many decades. But they can be used better, more effectively and with much less pollution. This design isn’t just smaller, cheaper and more powerful. It isn’t some interesting science project. It encompasses all the requisite attributes to make it into mass production and in the process actually make the world a better, cleaner, safer place to be. We’re proud of these goals. Why help? We’re going to make a difference. You can too.
Please help us, any way you can.

story:
The World’s First Universal 10-in-1 USB-C Super Dock for Windows and Mac

Designed and engineered for universal compatibility across all USB-C enabled computers/tablet/phones, the 10-in-1 USB-C SUPER Dock provides access to all of the most popular ports required for use at home, at the office and on-the-go. 

 

 

 

Introducing the Super Dock

The Dual USB-C Super Hub has a twin USB-C cable that integrates Power, USB and DP Alt Mode functions. The dock features twin USB-C cables with one USB-C cable being primary and the other being secondary. 

Both the USB-C connectors can be connected when used with a Mac to support 2 x displays – 4K@60hz (Primary HDMI - 1) + 4K@60Hz (Secondary HDMI - 2) from 2 x HDMI outputs along with other downstream ports. If only one USB-C connector (Primary) is connected, the dock will support 2 x displays – 4K@60Hz in dual display set up via the 2 x HDMI (1 & 2) along with other downstream ports.

Only the primary USB-C connector will be used with a Windows computer and the dock will support 2 x displays – 4K@30Hz in dual display set up via the 2 x HDMI (1 & 2) along with other downstream ports. The dock also features a USB-C (USB.1 Gen1) downstream port with 5G Data and up to 100W of Power Pass thru.

*Supports dual 4k@60Hz with a USB-C (DP 1.4) enabled Windows Computer/Laptop

 

What can the Super Dock do?

Increase  the functionality of MacBook Pro/Air, iPad Pro, Windows and Chromebook devices with the ALOGIC 10-in-1 USB-C Super Dock. Designed and engineered for  universal compatibility across all USB-C enabled computers/tablet/phones, the  10-in-1 USB-C Super Dock provides access to all of the most popular ports required  for use at home, at the office and on-the-go.

 

Compact and Portable

 

 

Twin USB-C Cables for Windows and Mac Compatibility 

The Super Dock supports two displays at  resolutions of up to 4K UHD 60Hz connected to the two HDMI 2.0 outputs.

In addition to the ability to connect  external monitors, the dock provides access to a full range of connections for  USB-C and USB-A peripherals, Ethernet, audio devices and SD and Micro SD card  readers for transferring your data, photos and videos.

With support for USB Power  Delivery Passthrough, you can connect your computer to a wide range of  peripherals and even charge it from the Super Dock with up to 100W of power over  a single cable (requires a suitable USB PD power supply, available  separately).

The dock also features a lock  slot for securing it to a desk when being used in an office or a hot desking  environment. 

 

Innovation

ALOGIC’s design innovation has allowed us to make the Super Dock small and easy to transport without compromising on any functionality. With the Super Dock your device becomes a portable workstation capable of delivering all the performance you need whether at your desk or on the road. 

 

 

Universal Compatibility : Windows  & Mac

The Super Dock features twin upstream  USB-C cables to provide support for a wide range of computers. The twin USB-C cables are designed for ultimate flexibility and universal compatibility across all USB-C devices. The two USB-C connectors are magnetic and can be  connected or detached as required giving the flexibility to use the dock with  any USB-C (or Thunderbolt 3) enabled device.

Of the two upstream USB-C cables on  the Super Dock, one is a primary and the other a secondary connection. When  used with Windows computers, the dock will operate with only the primary cable  connected and will power a dual monitor setup (refer to resolution support  table for more information) and other connected accessories. Both the primary  and secondary cables can be used with Windows computers enabled with dual  USB-C outputs for the best performance and resolution support.

The dock is designed to be a natural  extension of your Macbook Pro/Air. The twin magnetic connectors are especially  designed to match the dual USB-C (Thunderbolt 3) outputs on the Macbook  Pro/Air. The dock performs at its best with support for dual 4K displays and  all other accessories with Macs when both the USB-C connectors are plugged in.

When  the secondary cable is not in use, it can be clipped to itself for storage for  a tidy setup.

 

Design

Our goal with the Super Dock was to create a design that would fit into not only the Apple ecosystem, but with all brands of laptops and devices seamlessly. We wanted a modern look that would not stand out or intrude on your setup whilst also providing great flexibility when on-the-go.

 

Specifications

 

Upstream Ports

2 x USB-C with MA
1 x USB-C 3.1 Port - DP Alt Mode with Power Pass Thru – Windows

 

Downstream Ports

1 x USB-C 3.1 Gen 1 (5G) with Power Pass thru   100W – Data + Power (DP1.4 spec)
1 x USB-C 3.1 Gen 1 (5G) – Data Only
2 x USB-A 3.0 (5G)
1 x Audio / Microphone TRRS, support both CTIA and OMTP
1 x RJ45 Ethernet 1Gbps
1 x SD Card & Micro SD Card
2 x HDMI

ALOGIC Team

ALOGIC is a leading manufacturer of a Premium range of IT Peripherals,  consumer electronics and mobility products. We are dedicated at making  products that help realize the true potential of technology in making  our lives simpler and efficient everyday.

We have pioneered the market at making products, which are Smart and Simple at the same time. Our products are designed to “just work” with  the easiest to use design. All the products are researched &  developed in house by our R&D team.

 

 

Timeline

2 Year Warranty

ALOGIC warrants that our products will be free from defects in materials and workmanship.  If you feel your ALOGIC product is faulty and requires replacement, please contact us at support@alogic.co.  Once we have verified your issue, you will receive a case number before proceeding further.

 

Risks and challenges

No project is without risk, but we have done our absolute best to minimize all possible risks and challenges. We are a leading brand  in USB-C Products and Docking Stations, so rest assured we will deliver a technically qualified premium product in your hand .

The product you see above is an actual working prototype that has been rigorously tested over a number of months. At ALOGIC we pride ourselves on quality and reliable products. 

With your support, we can bring the Super Dock to the users worldwide. We thank each and every one of you who have supported on our journey so far.

story:
Summary

The ARK United Methodist Church believes in sharing the love of Christ and the grace of God through acts of random kindness. We are a church that believes in being the hands & feet of Christ on Earth.  Your donation creates a unique opportunity for you to provide these ARK's through our Church.  While we are much more than bread, blankets, Bibles, and gardens, these gifts provide the foundation for evangelism in our community, state, region and throughout the entire country.  Below you'll find stories detailing how our various outreach project and events have impacted folks and communities, but we're always open for suggestion!  

Check our our really cool perks and contribute!  Remember....without the bread of life, your toast!

www.arkumc.org




Who are we, and what do we do?

There is nothing fancy about us. We humbly gather to celebrate God’s love in whatever place is “ours” at the time. We are like a group of kids building a clubhouse; it doesn’t take much for us to be happy. We all just think it is cool that we have a place to go. We have gathered in many places over the years from an office building basement, to a big house, the elementary gym, to our current location, a fireworks stand. If you think a church building needs stain glass & wooden pews we will disappoint you. If you want to worship with a group of people who like to hug & laugh when we won’t let you down. 

We've been through a lot of changes in the past few years....but what has stayed consistent is that we are a group of people who believe.

We listen to the needs of the community, and we follow God's will.  Our goal is to 

find ways to touch our community with God’s love. The Ark has provided many and varied services to residents of the community. The church surveyed residents to find out if they were in need of lawn services, changing light bulbs, putting away lawn furniture, hanging wreaths on gables of home, taking people to doctors or for groceries, providing meals for infirmed, furnishing food for those who were temporarily in need, taking communion to home bound people. Many residents responded and were thrilled that someone cared about their needs. All of these activities were provided freely with smiles and caring for our neighbors. During the Christmas Holidays, cookie trays are made and delivered to schools, the Police department and the elderly in the area.


Here is are a few other examples of how we impact our community: 

  • Friends and Family gatherings
  • Parent's Night Out
  • ARK Christmas cards
  • A community New Year's Eve party
  • A community Easter breakfast.


More often than not the things we do are just random thoughts that God has laid on one of our hearts. It is fun to pretend that we are in God’s boardroom strategizing on new ways to show people, God’s love. We have learned over the years that we can try anything once. We never have much of a budget; ok, in all honesty I don’t know that we have ever had a budget. When we get a project rolling the materials, workers & food just shows up. Our church name is appropriate (ARK), however sometimes I think we should have called our church,” The Church of Stone Soup”. Most days we are lucky to have a pot that doesn’t leak. But in the end God always surprises us.

We have always been blessed with enough. In all honestly God makes me laugh at how he puts things in place for us, how he shows up to help us complete the task. There is nothing special about any of us at the ARK except that we believe, we have imagination & follow through. 





Why we need you!

The ARK needs funding to continue our evangelism and acts of random kindness.  Since we are a small but growing Church, we don't have an abundance of funds for our outreach. We believe that these ark's are the Holy Spirit working through our members to bring others closer to Christ.  We recently decided to build the Garden of ARK so to help beautify our place of worship. Since the creation of our Garden, we've realized that our acts of kindness are not limited to our community.  

But first, why build a garden? Because, the grass by our parking lot couldn’t look any less like a field.  And because, one Sunday, in a Church meeting it was laid on our hearts to plant some flowers.  And really how hard can it be to start a garden? (Harder than you think, did I say it was a field?) This project will take us several years to get to the point where people say what a beautiful garden. Right now we are at the stage where people say what is the ARK up to now? But those who know us shake their heads & say “just you wait… “


Before the first flower was ever planted we got an “outdoor chapel” for our garden. Ok, so it is the bus stop from Riv-r-land (a neighborhood in our community.) But the roof doesn’t leak & it is a great place to sit & pray. Our “chapel” also, blocks the flashing “Casino, Liquor” sign on the back of the gas station that faces our church.

So now we have an open door chapel, how cool is that? We are located on Exit 2 of South Dakota on I-29, with our location so close to the interstate we don’t keep our building unlocked. So the open door chapel will be a welcome place for praying & seeking sanctuary from the elements. “Seeking sanctuary” seems dramatic doesn’t it? Since this spring we know of several couples who have been traveling & they did in fact seek sanctuary in our little chapel.

God knows the needs of his people, God knows how to align ideas, God fulfill the needs of those who love him. So God was with us in the flood, God was with us in the recovery, God set in the hearts of the kids of Riv-r-land, that they didn’t need a bus stop, God gave the idea to use it was a “chapel”, God found a way to move it, God set it in a place that when his people who had little, were traveling by foot, they could be kept dry by a roof that was put in the right place at the right time for this children to sleep in.

And now you can help us grow our garden, share the warmth of a blanket, know that when the sun sets in the west that you have helped to keep one of God’s people dry & warm. That as they lay on the wooden bench looking out the window as the sunsets that tonight they found sanctuary, at exit 2 in South Dakota. 


The Perks

We really weren't stuck in the "B" mode when we came up with our perks....it just looks like it.  


The Bread of Life is the foundation for our perks and one of the foundations of our Church.   John 6:35: I am the bread of life.  Whoever comes to me will never go hungry, and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty.   And besides that, it is REALLY good bread!



We have put together our Bread, Blankets and Bible perks with acts of random kindness in mind.  While you will receive the bread for yourself no matter what level of contribution you select, the Bible and the blanket will be donated to a person in need in your name (or anonymously.)

The Bricks and the Blocks and the Birch are items that will be placed in our garden to commemorate your generosity and help beautify our sanctuary.  

Of course, all of these donations are tax deductible and the ARK is a registered 501(c)(3)  and we will provide all of the documentation you need to ensure your receive  credit for your generosity.  


The Impact

It's a common belief that there are actually 5 apostles: Matthew, Mark, Luke & John…the 5th is you.

Many people you will meet today don’t know the first four, but they do know you. As a Christian then it is our job to tell the world about their words. My favorite strings of words in the English language are, from John. “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life. For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.”

Take notice of the blessings, & the details God has set before you. Add them to the sermon of your life & share them with those who may not know, Matthew, Mark, Luke & John.

Through the words of our mouth & the meditations of our heart, we can be the 5th apostle to those we find in our lives…We are just all part of God’s details.


Local News Story


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially: 

  • share this with anyone and everyone to help the ARK spread the love of Christ. 
  • pray for us so that we can continue to provide acts of random kindess
  • consider conducting your own acts of random kindness in the name of Christ

A community New Year's Eve party


A community Easter breakfast.





More
often than not the things we do are just random
thoughts that God has laid on one of our hearts. It is fun to pretend that we
are in God’s boardroom strategizing on new ways to show people, God’s love. We
have learned over the years that we can try anything once. We never have much
of a budget; ok, in all honesty I don’t know that we have ever had a budget.
When we get a project rolling the materials, workers & food just shows up.
Our church name is appropriate (ARK), however sometimes I think we should have
called our church,” The Church of Stone Soup”. Most days we are lucky to have a
pot that doesn’t leak. But in the end God always surprises us. 
We have
always been blessed with enough. In all honestly God makes me laugh at how he
puts things in place for us, how he shows up to help us complete the task.
There is nothing special about any of us at the ARK except that we believe, we have imagination &
follow through. 












Why we need you!

The ARK needs funding to continue our evangelism and acts of random kindness.  Since we are a small but growing Church, we don't have an abundance of funds for our outreach. We believe that these ark's are the Holy Spirit working through our members to bring others closer to Christ.  We recently decided to build the Garden of ARK so to help beautify our place of worship. Since the creation of our Garden, we've realized that our acts of kindness are not limited to our community.  
But first, why build a garden? Because, the
grass by our parking lot couldn’t look any less like a field.  And because, one Sunday, in a Church meeting
it was laid on our hearts to plant some flowers.  And really how hard can it be to start a
garden? (Harder than you think, did I say it was a field?) This project will
take us several years to get to the point where people say what a beautiful
garden. Right now we are at the stage where people say what is the ARK up to
now? But those who know us shake their heads & say “just you wait… “


Before the
first flower was ever planted we got an “outdoor chapel” for our garden. Ok, so
it is the bus stop from Riv-r-land (a neighborhood in our community.) But the roof doesn’t leak & it is a
great place to sit & pray. Our “chapel” also, blocks the flashing “Casino,
Liquor” sign on the back of the gas station that faces our church. 

So now we
have an open door chapel, how cool is that? We are located on Exit 2 of South
Dakota on I-29, with our location so close to the interstate we don’t keep our
building unlocked. So the open door chapel will be a welcome place for praying
& seeking sanctuary from the elements. “Seeking sanctuary” seems dramatic
doesn’t it? Since this spring we know of several couples who have been
traveling & they did in fact seek sanctuary in our little chapel.
God knows
the needs of his people, God knows how to align ideas, God fulfill the needs of
those who love him. So God was with us in the flood, God was with us in the
recovery, God set in the hearts of the kids of Riv-r-land, that they didn’t
need a bus stop, God gave the idea to use it was a “chapel”, God found a way to
move it, God set it in a place that when his people who had little, were
traveling by foot, they could be kept dry by a roof that was put in the right
place at the right time for this children to sleep in.
And now you
can help us grow our garden, share the warmth of a blanket, know that when the
sun sets in the west that you have helped to keep one of God’s people dry &
warm. That as they lay on the wooden bench looking out the window as the
sunsets that tonight they found sanctuary, at exit 2 in South Dakota. 


The Perks
We really weren't stuck in the "B" mode when we came up with our perks....it just looks like it.  

The Bread of Life is the foundation for our perks and one of the foundations of our Church.   John 6:35: I am the bread of life.  Whoever comes to me will never go hungry, and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty.   And besides that, it is REALLY good bread!








We have put together our Bread, Blankets and Bible perks with acts of random kindness in mind.  While you will receive the bread for yourself no matter what level of contribution you select, the Bible and the blanket will be donated to a person in need in your name (or anonymously.)
The Bricks and the Blocks and the Birch are items that will be placed in our garden to commemorate your generosity and help beautify our sanctuary.  
Of course, all of these donations are tax deductible and the ARK is a registered 501(c)(3)  and we will provide all of the documentation you need to ensure your receive  credit for your generosity.  




The Impact

It's a common belief that there are actually 5 apostles: Matthew, Mark, Luke & John…the 5th is
you.
Many people
you will meet today don’t know the first four, but they do know you. As a
Christian then it is our job to tell the world about their words. My favorite
strings of words in the English language are, from John. “For God so loved the
world, that he gave his only son, that whosoever believeth in him should not
perish, but have everlasting life. For God sent not his Son into the world to
condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.”
Take notice
of the blessings, & the details God has set before you. Add them to the
sermon of your life & share them with those who may not know, Matthew,
Mark, Luke & John.
Through the
words of our mouth & the meditations of our heart, we can be the 5th
apostle to those we find in our lives…We are just all part of God’s details.

Local News Story



Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially: 



share this with anyone and everyone to help the ARK spread the love of Christ. 


pray for us so that we can continue to provide acts of random kindess

consider conducting your own acts of random kindness in the name of Christ

story:
What is VisualSaaS?

Do you have a great idea for a new Salesforce, but don't want to write every line of code yourself?  Do you want to create a simple registration app for your club without spending every second of your free time doing it? If so, then VisualSaaS is for you!


VisualSaaS is a service that allows structured applications to be built and run entirely in the Cloud.

VisualSaaS offers a full, visual development environment where developers can build any application based on structured, tabular data, all through a simple point-and-click designer. Collaboration is built in to VisualSaaS, from code control and sharing, through interactive design tools, to immediate availability for end users. It is particularly suited to Agile development. VisualSaaS comes with a hosted, industrial strength PostgreSQL database by default, but through the use of connectors it can be tightly integrated with existing relational database systems.

VisualSaaS is ideal for organisations that want to build and modify applications quickly and reliably - organisations that want to be able to respond rapidly to operating conditions. VisualSaaS offers a range of productivity tools. Template applications can be adapted using these tools and further enhanced with readily-available skills. User training is kept to an absolute minimum.  

What Problem does VisualSaaS Solve?

Many organisations have spreadsheets and databases holding information that is vital to the efficient running of their operations. This information is often held in multiple applications on multiple servers in the office. Users often do not know which version of the information they have. Handling changes to the data is also difficult if extracts or copies of the data have to be sent to users by email, as someone has to merge any changes back into the main source of data.

VisualSaaS solves these problems by providing a set of tools to enable any authorised user to build and enhance applications quickly and easily, while allowing data from the existing spreadsheets and databases to be imported. The data is then immediately available wherever, whenever and however you want. Applications developed by VisualSaaS are easy for users to understand and engage with, and allow organisations to reap the numerous benefits of running services in the Cloud.

VisualSaaS is immediately different from every other web-based business system. It provides a Windows-style interface delivered through a browser allowing users to work the way they want, not the way the system dictates. While the vast majority of web sites display information one page at a time, VisualSaaS allows one or more forms to be displayed simultaneously and dragged around the screen to fit the user's needs – just what users are familiar with on their desktop PC or Mac.

What will the Funds be Used For?

We want to raise £45,000 so that we can concentrate on making this a well-rounded product that people can easily use. To do this we need to:
  • clear up known issues
  • complete the documentation for developers, covering help pages, videos, and worked examples
  • provide more attributes to control UI widgets
  • support more external database types
  • implement better separation of applications and re-use of components in libraries
  • provide a graphical CSS editor for easier styling of applications
  • build an API so that scripts and programs running remotely can access data within VisualSaaS
  • link to external file stores, such an Box, OneDrive, and DropBox
  • and we can always add more widgets and add more flexibility to widgets
Our plan is to make the service available for public use by 1st October 2014, once the known issues have been cleared up and the documentation has been put in place. After this, we will continue working on the other features while supporting active users of the service.

If we don't get all the funds we are looking for, we will still concentrate on clearing up the known issues and putting the documentation in place, while aiming for a public launch as soon as possible.

Risks & Challenges

We have been building systems for people for over 50 years between us, so we have in-depth knowledge about what features VisualSaaS must offer to make it useful to developers. However, neither of us are into (or understand) marketing so getting the message out to the world is something we need help with (see Other Ways You Can Help). Our plan is to use a portion of the service fees, which will come in when VisualSaaS is released to the public, for advertising and marketing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help, but aren't able to contribute, we are looking for volunteers:
  • to help with the PR and marketing of VisualSaaS so that we build up our web presence,
  • with a good eye for design who can help create a set of CSS templates for VisualSaaS so that we can look good as well be good, and
  • who can help us to compile and format documentation so that is available as PDFs and on our web site.
If you think VisualSaaS may be interesting to someone you know, please use the Indiegogo share tools!


About Us

We have worked together for many years as independent software designers and developers, and over that time have designed, built and tested many applications based on relational databases. As anyone who has built this type of application is aware, there is a lot of repetition in what is done.

Over the last 15 years we have worked pre-dominantly on web-based applications that have been used to share data amongst workforces that are both geographically dispersed and not employed by a single company.  And we have found that while there are many tools for building amazing looking web sites with all manner of fancy UI controls, when it comes to linking these to a back-end database or two, you are pretty much left to get on with it by yourself.

So we decided to build our own graphical toolkit with integrated UI controls to allow us to build sophisticated web applications that are, most importantly, tightly linked to a fully functional relational database. And it was built in the Cloud so we could jointly build systems and rapidly roll out changes to our customers. After 3 years work and many successful customer deployments, we got to thinking that it was rude to keep this toolkit for our own exclusive use, and we now want to make it available for anyone to use. And we have now given 'it' a name...VisualSaaS.


The Team

Basil Fisk

Basil has in-depth experience of introducing web-based services into business processes, and has designed SaaS systems running on VMs and EC2, using SVG, JavaScript, node.js and Perl.  He designed the architecture for three leading IPTV entertainment systems for the hospitality market and is named as inventor on 4 International Patents relating to digital entertainment systems.


Ian "Jamie" Jamieson

Jamie has detailed knowledge of JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, PHP, node.js, PostgreSQL and SQL Server.  He has worked with several multi-national technology companies and with the NHS to define processes, deliver online reporting and operational systems, and provide advice on technology infrastructure for new web-based business.

story:
BMN is a collection of innovative and powerful news media brands that deliver compelling and visually engaging programming for African Americans. BMN will feature world-class brands including Morning Day®, 197.5 The Drop®, Politics as Usual®, Gametime®, "Black Industry®, Dollars and Sense®, Nightly News®, Original Documentaries, and more. Providing the best in breaking news, live video coverage,  original journalism, lifestyle features and commentary. BMN is forecast to reach audiences of more than 15 million. 

(Supporters that contribute $200.00 or more and own a business earn a scheduled interview on "Black Industry®" to market their brand and or company.) See our campaign video

story:
"RovAir is an innovative company with sustainable and creative ideas that will help provide a viable and affordable option for internet connectivity to a segment of our society who otherwise would not have the ability to afford Internet access."   - U.S. Senator John Kerry (read his Letter of Support).

 

**RovAir News**

 

A dynamic thread on all things RovAir throughout the campaign

 

3.26.13 - Nice article on Collaborative Consumption  http://www.policymic.com/articles/30903/how-col...

3.02.13 - Successful test of 4G LTE personal hotspot for RovAir OnDemand service!  Very encouraging.  Wouldn't it be nice to have your own device and have RovAir activate it only when you need it?

2.26.13 - Please see a very simple video explaning how mobile broadband data can be shared with unrelated end users and optimized.  http://vimeo.com/55536851

2.15.13 - Another RovAir mention for improving productivity at work - http://www.useoftechnology.com/business-technologies/

2-11.13 - Another nice article on RovAir - http://www.triplepundit.com/2013/02/rovair-please-pass-hot-spot/

Great new Article posted this weekend on the WSJ's Allthingsd.com http://allthingsd.com/20130126/rovair-aims-to-be-the-airbnb-for-mobile-broadband-plans/ 

Followed by Fiercebroadbandwireless.com http://www.fiercebroadbandwireless.com/story/rovair-raising-cash-demand-mobile-broadband-service/2013-01-28 

2-6-13 - TechInvestorNews

http://www.techinvestornews.com/Mobile/Latest-Mobile-News/rovair-raising-cash-for-on-demand-mobile-broadband-service

 

Interest about RovAir is growing. Come join the revolution! 

Why is this campaign important?  "4 in 5"

Many resources are not scarce.  However, they can be unattainable.  Mobile broadband is certainly a good example.  We often take for granted just how empowering reliable connectivity can be to our lives; how it can enrich many aspects of our lives.  We also assume that access is everywhere. The fact is, over 119 million persons in the US alone do not have broadband access, 1 in 3 persons.  The world numbers are even more disparate as an astounding 4 in 5 persons do not have reliable access. 

There are many reasons why broadband access may be difficult to obtain.  It could be unaffordable or there may be a lack of infrastructure, but in all cases a lack of access puts persons at a competitive, educational, social and market disadvantage.

We at RovAir thought about what could happen if we could SHARE broadband resources and make them more attainable for all.  The ability to introduce mobile broadband into the Sharing Economy, by allowing those with access to share with others, can bring affordable access to many more persons.  By sharing costs and benefits in a collaborative way, all parties involved can benefit greatly; from the individual to the business to the network carrier.  The opportunity in developing nations is even more staggering.  It is hugely important issue, with a potentially huge impact for millions of people.  RovAir is pioneering mobile broadband into the Sharing Economy.

What does RovAir do?

We provide on demand mobile broadband access. Anywhere you can get a cellular signal you can get online, anytime you want.  We call it RovAir OnDemand. 

How does RovAir do it?

We can turn on mobile broadband devices only when you need it and for any time period.  Then we turn it off when you are finished. We use a Collaborative Consumption platform that lets us share our lines, or other companies', with you, when you want it.


What is a mobile broadband device?

It is a USB stick or personal wifi hotspot which allows you to connect a laptop, tablet or smartphone to the internet over a wireless data network.

 

Where would I use a device like this?

Just about anywhere - for your business trip, a weekend getaway, at a tradeshow, at the airport, even the beach.  Anywhere you need quick and convenient access to the internet.  No need to go searching for WiFi.  It can now be in your pocket.

When would I use a device like this?

Anytime you require the internet way from your home or office.  The completion of the web-based interface will allow you to connect from any location at anytime.  No need to go searching for WiFi.  It can now be in your pocket, ready to use whenever you need it.

What does it cost?

Because we use 100% refurbished devices, we are good for your pocketbook and the environment.  We can usually provide devices for under $50.  You can also rent them.  Or, you can search for a compatible device in a number of online outlets.  The RovAir OnDemand service costs just a few dollars per day, but you connect only when you want and pay for only when you use it.

What is the project?

We are seeking to complete a web-based platform which will allow us to provide automatic activations and also provide connections down to the hour or even for just minutes at a time.  It is an interface for you. . . to schedule activations, add time and share with others. 

We also want to procure more compatible equipment and get it in your hands so you can use the service whenever you like.

Why is RovAir different?

We do it through a very cool platform called Collaborative Consumption, part of the emerging Sharing Economy.  Time Magazine called it one of the “Ten Ideas That Will Change the World” It allows us to identify unused broadband resources, lines and data, and SHARE it with you, your company, or a program in need.  In fact, we are working with one program in need right now, Tech Goes Home.  Take a look...

 

What is so cool about Collaborative Consumption?

Collaborative Consumption re-imagines how we can access things by sharing them.  It says if we can identify and re-allocate unused resources, we can allow many more people access to these resources, sharing both the cost and the benefit.  RovAir identifies broadband resources, lines and data, and shares it with you.  It’s all part of the new Sharing Economy.  A lot of great companies use the same methodology, Airbnb, ZipCar, TaskRabbit, RelayRides.  See the video. . .

 

What else can you do to help?

We know it is not always possible to contribute funds, but you can help us considerably if you can forward this link to your network via Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit or any other social media outlet.

We thank you so much for your support.  Only together can we bring mobile broadband and all of the benefits of living, working and interacting in a connected society to many, many more people.

We know it is not always possible to contribute funds, but you can help us considerably if you can forward this link to your network via Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit or any other social media outlet.
We thank you so much for your support.  Only together can we bring mobile broadband and all of the benefits of living, working and interacting in a connected society to many, many more people.

story:
Have you ever struggled with accomplishing a goal?

Have you ever made a commitment to yourself like, "This is it!  I am done!  I am not living like this anymore.  From this day forward, I am no longer......  And then two days later you are doing whatever it was that you said you were never going to do.
Research has shown that if you can identify some key behaviors along with some specific ways to remind yourself about why you want to change, your chances of success increase significantly.  Nowadays there are so many apps available to help people accomplish great things. There are many apps that help people with diet and nutrition - tracking food intake and calories spent.  But we haven't found an app yet that will do what we want this app to do.
This app can be personalized to help you find the things that specifically inspire your own success.  It will have an accountability component that allows you to share your daily goals and successes with others- regardless of the goal.  It will allow you to upload your own music, movies, and pictures.  You can record or write your own motivational messages.
We have used the concepts of this app with hundreds of individuals who have built their own survival kits.  Using these homemade kits has improved the health and well-being of hundreds of individuals nationwide.  We are confident that bringing this concept to the technology stage will drastically improve the success rates of thousands of individuals.
We need your help.

To develop an app with that does the magnitude of things we are hoping, requires financial funding.  We will be using the funding to hire an developer who can build an inspiring and functional app. The money we raise will be used to help in the development of the app. 

Unfortunately, the cost of building the app is expensive.  Without the support of generous contributors, there is a chance this app will not be made. We need your support. Even a generous donation of $10 will help us get one step closer to our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't can’t contribute, you can still help.

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this life changing app.
  • Use the share tool.

story:
Want to show your Work or Business to Hundreds of Millions of people but don't know how?

We can help you by giving you a very Easy and Powerful tool. An Online App Creator that will let you build a Professional App in less than 10 minutes, EVEN IF YOU DON'T HAVE ANY CODING OR PROGRAMMING EXPERIENCE! By creating an intuitive IOS / Android App, you can reach over 500 Million IOS (Apple) users and over 1 Billion Android users instantly! 


Get more exposure. 

Get costumers faster than ever! 

Increase your sales like never before!

Take advantage of the ever growing Digital World!

Everyone wants to have a mobile Web site, a mobile application, and to look good on an iPhone, iPad, or Kindle. The problem is where to start. What do you need? What do you use? Do you need to outsource? The list gets overwhelming. Thankfully we can help you achieve those goals.

We designed a very Easy and Powerful Online App Creator that needs a little push to start growing. With your valuable help, we can start getting new and important costumers, and hopefully one day expand to an International market!

Our Online App Creator is VERY EASY TO USE, and it will let you show millions of costumers what you do for a living, what services do you offer, and show your contact information so people can easily find you.


If you have a business you can show it to the world! 

You can show your products and give people the ability to easily buy them right from the App! Why only sell locally when you can have a worldwide business!

The possibilities are endless! Don't wait anymore, act now!

With our App Creator, you can finish a Professional grade App in less than 10 minutes! Even if you don't know anything about Code or Programming!


Just choose a TEMPLATE YOU LIKE from over 50 Designs, and modify it by adding your personal information, photos, videos, Facebook page, maps, etc.


Features intuitive Widgets that will amaze your costumers! Including Google Maps and Calendar integration, Sell products directly from the App, tap to call / send email / take picture options, music share, show your contact information, news feed, fan wall, and many more!

The world is evolving faster than ever and people are using their mobile phones to do tasks that previously could only be done over a computer. They are using it more than ever to buy millions of products online.

Don't be left behind, join this digital revolution and make your work thrive like never before!

We value your help, even if you don't want an app, you can make a big difference in our lives by making this dream come true! Thank you for your time!

story:
So what is the best UV Flashlight? Why HUNT22?

Traditional UV torches are bulky to carry around and, most keyring UV torches are low quality with weak beam.

HUNT22 is the toughest and smallest UV flashlight you've ever seen; finger-sized yet with maximum durability and the strongest light beam in any product this size. 

 

 

Testing has proven that our flashlight is virtually indestructible. In fact, we're so confident of the quality that, it's definitely a LIFETIME use body!

 

 

Constructed from high quality titanium, the key chain design can be attached to almost anything... keys, bags, zippers... so you'll always have it to hand. 

 

Tiny Size

 

Bring the party lights to your keyring!

 

UV flashlights can be incredibly useful in a number of settings:

story:
• $800K Stretch Goal - Free HiPen H3 Stylus

  • $350K Stretch Goal - Add a Fingerprint Sensor FOR FREE​

  • ​256GB/512GD SSD Storage Add-on Perk​

  • ​RAM Upgrade Pack (8GB to 16GB)







MiniBook is an ultra-tiny laptop (or UMPC)  which measures just 1/4 the size of a traditional notebook - even with its fully integrated keyboard.  The unique 360° flipping YOGA design allows MiniBook to be transformed into laptop, workstation or tablet with a simple twist.



Minibook is all about optimal performance. The Intel Core m3-8100Y processor, 8GB of LPDDR3 RAM and 128GB storage enable you to finish business work, game playing, movie watching and run almost any program as you like. It’s like three machines in one, at a bargain price.


 



Work

Entertainment

Study







When we discovered that other UMPCs in the market still have some drawbacks  it inspired us to develop MiniBook to optimize the customer experience.

From the outset, we collected user evaluation and product data for UMPC devices from different channels. We crunched the numbers and concluded that the core reasons that UMPC owners switched to other devices are dissatisfaction with small screens, memory capacity, appearance,  keyboard and camera.

Since then, our team has devoted itself to creating the best MiniBook possible

1. Screen

Our experience of the PC industry has taught us that the Windows operating system works far better with an 8-inch and 16:10 screen ratio. How do we know? Our Chuwi Hi8 SE is the most popular Windows tablet, selling more than one million units worldwide.


2. SSD expansion slot

For the first time, our engineers have found a way to fit an M.2 SSD card slot into Minibook, so users can expand their storage. Minibook is the world's first UMPC with expandable storage like this. Plus, if that’s not enough, there’s room for an microSD card to expand even further.

 

3. Unique YOGA 360° rotating design

Feedback from our community tells us that versatility is a big plus for users, so we subverted the traditional UMPC design concept on the MiniBook. The unique 360° flipping bracket can be switched to multiple scene modes such as tablet, notebook and workstation.

4. Keyboard

The Minibook will be available in two keyboard layouts - Japanese and US English for maximum productivity.

Our brand new keyboard layout fits a full-sized, full-spaced layout in the smallest of form factors.

 

5. Camera

The UMPC format is ideal for business people to conduct video conferences from anywhere - but only if there is a built-in camera. Most UMPC brands said ‘no’, ignoring user needs. But where they say ‘no’, we say ‘YES!’, so, we decided to add a built-in camera, to let the user connect to the world in the palm of the hand.



 



​




Appearance  

  • MiniBook comes in ‘Business Space Grey’ with a unique exterior refinishing technology
  • Precision CNC cutting craft provides a far better feel in the hand
  • MiniBook was built as portable as cellphone, with the convenience of single hand operation. 
  • Slip it into your pocket, take it to work or play anywhere you choose. 



The 8-inch yoga 360° flipping UMPC will bridge the divide between laptop and tablet, you can be sure of that.. It can be switched into diverse modes such as laptop, tablet, or gaming station. With our creative flipping function, every angle degree is under your control. This allows you to work in restricted spaces comfortably, on planes, on trains, in coffee bars. You can also hold the MiniBook and use it with ease standing up or on the bus.


Screen

A 9-inch screen would ruin the portability, but a 7-inch screen struggles with text-heavy applications like Excel. That’s why we’ve chosen  the perfect 8-inch and 16:10 screen ratios devices for Minibook. Small size screens don’t always display standard fonts or will blur images, so we developed our professional display optimization system to bring a vivid photo and clear font.

But it’s not just size that matters. That’s why Minibook has a  high resolution 1920*1200, full Lamination touch LCD screen for an accurate and quick response. It gives you a precise and vivid display and an eye-friendly operation which can ease  fatigue and eyestrain during long sessions of working, reading, and gaming. What`s more, the 16:10 widescreen ratio helps you get the best view of larger charts or articles.

 

CPU & GPU     

MiniBook will be available with two variants of models - one with Intel Core M3 8100Y the other boasting an Intel Celeron N4100 processor to fit different needs and budgets. Adopt the invincible INTEL CORE M3 8100Y processor, manufactured by 14 nm process, 5W TDP, built 2 cores with 4 threads inside to power through multitasking, whilst the 1.1Ghz-3.4Ghz high frequency for can speed through whatever demands you put it through. No matter what you engage in, whether office business, games, drawing, share exchanging, Minibook does it all.



The chart below is a comparison of the performance between Intel Celeron N4100 and Core m3-8100Y by Benchmark.



The integrated graphics card, UHD 615, is capable of 900MHz with dual channels memory cards, (UHD 600 for N4100 edition, 700Mhz), to boost performance, letting you conquer AAA class games and enjoy HD movie streams smoothly.

 

Heat Sink

We’ve designed a new generation of the active cooling system with an optimized silent fan: Better performance, noise cancellation - together we’ve halved the amount of fan noise of other products, with thermal extraction ensuring that high temperatures never slow down your processor.

 

 

Memory & Storage

We’ve used dual-channel LPDDR3 8GB memory cards in 1600 MHz frequency to ensure high performance in multitasking. The higher speed response and lower latency are what MiniBook is all about - it means we can do work on an Excel spreadsheet while video calling on Skype anytime.
Need more storage? No problem, we’ve got you covered. The MiniBook will come with a M.2 SSD, as well as microSD expansion ensuring ample storage for today's power users.



Solid state disk (SSD) is the next generation of disk -  it runs up to 5 times faster than HDD,. Amazingly we’ve been able to create a PCI-E slot to support the best NVME protocol SSD. It’s a unique design to hit the market offering the highest speed and largest capacity, bringing the UMPC to a new generation of customer.

(Note: N4100 edition contains with Sata SSD and adopts LPDDR4 8GB.)

 

Keyboard

We always listen to our customers, and this time is no different, thanks to the supportive backers from our database. It was clear that a full-size backlight keyboard could greatly enhance the experience of using our product. To make it even better we added optimized bigger keycap using a Super Optical Finger Navigation Module to make the most efficient UMPC ever!  The keyboard will elevate your experience of working and gaming.

Plus we’ll be offering two keyboard layouts: one with standard US English language keyboard and the other in Japanese, saving your time rather than adapting to a standard QWERTY keyboard.



MiniBook’s newly designed backlit keyboard, allows you to comfortably work at night or in dark spaces such as on long plane journeys without the need of external lighting. Moreover, the built-in gravity sensor, can automatically sense the switch to  tablet mode, making it more convenient to use.

 

Battery life

For long-time use on the go, CHUWI MiniBook packs a 26.6Wh high-capacity battery, with 7.6V input dedicated to fast charging. We’ve adopted the PD charging protocol.

Or for charging on the go - why not use a powerbank? Anything above 12V is supported.

 

 

Port & WiFi

Although we wanted to keep the profile of the MiniBook as small as possible, it still contains plentiful ports including 2*USB-A, a full function USB-C, and Mini HDMI.

With the full function type-c port, you can connect to a Hub to extend the number of ports to add others such as HDMI, VGA and U disk - and yes, you can still charge with the hub plugged in!

Don’t worry about connectivity - the Intel 3165 module for wireless Wi-Fi 2.4G/5G dual band and can roam between them if you’re on the move. No more frozen screens with high latency - just computing enjoyment.

 

Operating System

To make it suitable for all kinds of every day work and play, MiniBook comes equipped with a full Windows 10 version and gives you the full desktop experience, but with the benefits of a mobile device. That means MiniBook is not only the greatest compact for business, but also for creatives and artists. Whatsmore, you can sign papers, prepare for presentations, edit emails, industrial drawing, share market exchanging, etc anytime and anywhere, With Minibook, you can break the limits of productivity : that is what we aim for, and we think you’ll agree, we’ve achieved it too!









Share the MiniBook campaign with your friends and family to participate in our Referral Contest. Once they back the campaign directly using your referral link, both of you will get a EVA Bag  for FREE.

Here are more instructions about how to participate in this referral contest:

1. Log into your Indiegogo account. Then, click the ‘Link’ icon at the top of the campaign page .
2. You will see a popup with your unique link. Copy your unique URL (shown below) and share it to your social media or email your friends, etc.

Notes:

1. Anyone who has backed CHUWI MiniBook campaign can participate in this referral contest.
2. If the backer cancels their order or requests a refund before delivery, it will be regarded as an invalid order.
3. Don't leave your unique URL in the comments on this campaign, it will be regarded as an invalid order.
4. Don't forget to share after logging in the Indiegogo account, otherwise it will be regarded as invalid order.

More detail ,please click:
https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/203660683-How-to-Participate-in-a-Referral-Contest




At CHUWI, innovation is at the heart of our company. Earlier this year, we successfully delivered our AeroBook and UBook  product to more than 1500 backers who supported our mission to kick start a new laptop revolution. During this period, we had a batch of feedback from our supportive backers, with many requesting a powerful CPU but  a more portable size for next product. Our R&D team set to work considering “What if we lessen the device size while upgrade the performance, perhaps we could build something that’s ultra-compact but still energy efficient?”.  We never forgot, and it made us determined to make it to reality.

MiniBook is an ultra-mobile Personal Computer，(UMPC). UMPC’s have been considered “dream chasing” for a long time, because getting the right balance of size and power is tricky, especially for devices running Windows.

Where others have failed, undoubtedly because of limits of their hardware. inspiration would carry us, CHUWI goes beyond, to create a new generation device UMPC——MiniBook - after resolving the weaknesses of previous UMPC in performance, thermal taking, battery life and typing experience. At CHUWI, we want to bring the glory back to PC industry, to conquer every problem our predecessors struggled with.




 



As early backers, we are keen to reward you with some unique perks. All MiniBook units claimed as perks will have at least 25% off the planned retail price. Plus, Indiegogo backers will be the first to receive their products.

But more than that -  we would love you to join us on our journey to bring the product to life. Funds raised will go directly to funding the final design phases and manufacturing of the units ordered through the crowdfund. Oh - and if you like CHUWI MiniBook, please spread the word on social media or telling colleagues or friends about our campaign!







1. We aim to provide rewards as scheduled, however, please understand that delays may occur due to supply chain or quality control issues. Including:

▲Certification delays
▲Production delays
▲Supply Chain/Mass Production

We’ve done our best to forecast demand and we’ve learned a lot from past projects.  However,sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark.If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem to ensure you are with us every step of the way. We know that some crowdfunders have ended badly in the past - but never from CHUWI - we’ll always keep in touch with you, and welcome messages from you too!

Please, do not hesitate to contact us at crowdfunding@chuwi.com . We are looking forward to answer any of your questions.

2. Product specifications may change to ensure that the product is made as best as possible. If any changes occur, we will notify users in the “UPDATES” area of the crowdfunding page.
