story:
Risks and challenges

What we have:

1) Our own manufacture and many years of experience in business project management. We are confident in our ability to create original assembly models and bring joy to all those who supported us.

2) Experience in delivery and international transportation.
3) We have a well thought out plan how to proceed after the end of the project.
4) Our main marketing strategy is based on a true passion for mechanics and love for our work.

Our team is constantly engaged in developing of natural innovative models. This project is an extension of what we have achieved till now.

Our team is continuously working on new fascinating ideas for metal models. Current project will broaden and develop further what we have already achieved. With the support of Kickstarter – your support – Time For Machine can cross the borders of one country and offer our models to the world.
story_txt:
All models
 

From the most ancient times, we’ve been attracted by items made with soul, sense and idea. People put a lot of effort into design and technological advances of cars, mechanisms, planes and steam engines. Even after lots of time these items still captivate our minds just like the mechanical automatons of the past and figures by such wizards as Peter Carl Fabergé. Their inventions are presented in museums and exhibited in private collections.
In the modern world, due to modern technologies there is a possibility to become a wizard by yourself and you personally can create something as attractive and innovative.
That’s why we have set the goal to create the most beautiful construction set in the world. The set ,which you can easily assemble into a mechanical piece of art. Time for machine is the first exclusive construction set worth your attention.
We have already had a successful Kickstarter campaign in 2017. It was our first step, when we showed our first four models and fulfilled our obligations. Since that time we have fine-tuned our product, removed all shortcomings, reached better results in designing and assembling the models.
It's time to assemble
It’s time to Construct
Time For Machine is a new perspective in the world of construction sets - unique models made of metal, which you can personally assemble.
Each model has a detailed instruction in several languages. However, the assembling process will be much easier if you watch our video instructions. These video lessons will help you with mechanics and STEM 101.Inside the package you’ll see the special black envelope divided into sections. Special plates with metal parts will be inside. They're produced by chemical etching method and have smoothed and safe edges. Due to the special connections all parts can be easily separated from the plate. Parts can be easily bent by hands. In special the bottom compartments there are gears made of thick metal and a block with spring . Some models have special plywood moulds which can help to adjust the form of some elements of the model.
Each model can be assembled by using only tiny pliers. Parts are connected with each other with the easy twist of eyering. We also offer a set of professional assembling tools, which include 2 different types of pliers, 2 files and polishing cloth.

Dazzling Steamliner

All our models are mechanical and have their own story. Movement of a gear wheel is movement of life. Covered in bright armor this mechanism will become a real centerpiece of your interior and a useful gift to a friend.

The rapid train moves on the rails by the mechanical spring.
The plane moves propellers from the mechanism in its base.
Cars have clockwork mechanism and a steering system.
You can open the hood and see the way the mechanism works.
The Timer keeps the time.
The Tank overcomes the obstacles.

The ideal construction set shouldn’t only be attractive but also move beautifully. Heavenly Hercules


 

 

 Dazzling Steamliner
 

Model of a steamliner from universe of steampunk and dieselpunk, which resembles historical steamliners, which were covered in a sleek aerodynamic body.
These steamliners looked futuristic and fascinating. Dazzling steamliner is a top product of our company. The model is driven by a mechanical spring. From the top and side you can observe the movements of gear-wheel and flywheel inside the train. Layout of the wheels reminds the famous Union Pacific Big Boy. The wheelbase of the locomotive is 4-12-6. Model scale is 1:64. The width of rail is 24 mm. Coal tender can be unhooked from the locomotive.


Heavenly Hercules


A visionary plane remains the plane with the largest wingspan. Eight motor flying boat made of metal. The plane works from a mechanism in its base. A special mechanical formula allows all propellers to move simultaneously. You can take the plane off the base and study it thoroughly. The model is exciting to the viewer. The scale is 1:300.


Royal Voyager


An American dream car. A shining metal sedan of the era of big engines and rock stars of the 70s. The model has opening trunk and doors. You can raise the hood and learn more about the structure of the engine. The car looks elegant on an office desk. If you wind up the handle in the engine block and turn on the start lever, it will drive.


Marvel Tank 2


Updated version of the Marvel Tank. Optimized assembly. A model of the tank from the times of the First World War, made in a completely peaceful patterned style. Self-propelled machine that overcomes obstacles with its shiny tracks. Driven by a mechanical spring. Scale 1:56
Size 141*49*65 mm


Glorious Cabrio 2


Elegant cabrio with a long hood and hidden drive mechanism. The car is powered by a mechanical spring. It has a steering wheel that rotate the wheels. It’s possible to open the trunk, hood and even the glove box. Easy to assemble but very beautiful model. An excellent gift for lovers of elegant things.


Mysterious Timer 2


A small and beautiful clockwork that works up to 1 hour. The alarm will sound at the end of time. Mysterious Timer 2 is an updated version of the timer that has a simplified design for assembling. This model will work longer than any other similar timer. It allows you to watch the clock ticking clockwork for a long time.


Silver Bullet


Rapid sport car from the past - in the form of XXth century international car races winner. Open monocoque and wind in the face.
At the bottom of the body you can see the open tie rods that go to the front wheels. Under the hood are beautiful engine gears. Elegant version of the retro racing car which is powered by mechanical spring.


Hot Tractor


The tractor is created on designs of k700 heavy tractor. It is easy to assemble the model because it doesn’t have a spring. Inside this model is a mechanism which rotates from the wheels when the tractor is moving. The tractor has a realistic swivel rear axle. You can open the hood and learn more about the engine. The tractor also opens the cab doors.


Perfecto Card case
 
It's an elegant business card box. Pressing the lever opens the lid. The model is easy to assemble. It allows you to store business cards in a standard size from 5 to 9 cm.




 

Brief description of our pledges. Here you can learn more about all the rewards and models, to get the best model for yourself. Oh, yes...All our models are the best! Choose any and you will have the absolute perfection in the modeling world!

In this section you will find all the technical information about each set. And inspire yourself one more time, while watching video about the most beautiful construction set in the world!

 Video about Auto set



Video about Double set



Video about All Vehicle set.



Video about Hercules mono set



Video about double set + bullet



Video about Steamliner mono set



Video about Big Double set



Video about Full set



More information about add-ons

You can assemble models with any small pliers. But if you want to get the Time for Machine Professional Tool Set - you can add it for only 15 dollars.The set consists of 2 different types of pliers and 2 special files.
Attention! In some sets the toolset is already included for free. If you add the toolset to your reward - you don't have to pay extra funds for delivery. The delivery of toolset is free.

Every Full Set reward has free option for the engraving of your name on a Dazzling Steamliner (train) or Heavenly Hercules (plane). You can also add this option for extra 20 USD to the price of the reward and engrave your name on Dazzling Steamliner (train) or Heavenly Hercules (plane) models. The length of the inscription is not more than 12 characters. We will do a survey where you can specify which particular phrase or name to engrave on the model. This will happen after the end of the campaign.
ATTENTION! This option is available only in sets with Dazzling Steamliner (train) or Heavenly Hercules (plane) models.
Also you can add-on any model plus shipping costs
It's time for team

Our team consists of engineers, designers and technologists. More than 20 people work for Time for Machine in total.
Time for Machine company was founded in 2016. We have already had one successful kickstarter project in 2017. There were very few people in the team in those years. During the further development and execution of the previous Kickstarter we grew and gained experience. We replaced laser cutting production with chemical etching. This made the models much better and the edges of the parts safer. We redesigned the packaging and made it comfortable and elegant.
Several experienced designers joined our team from my past “Ugears” project. I would like to remind everyone that Time for Machine is a completely new project that has nothing to do with Ugears.
All this has led to the fact that we have a wide range of models and experience in their production.
Freedom. Wisdom. Interaction. 
Our team
We develop our models in Ukraine and also now we have a team in the USA.

Risks and challenges
What we have:
1) Our own manufacture and many years of experience in business project management. We are confident in our ability to create original assembly models and bring joy to all those who supported us.
2) Experience in delivery and international transportation.3) We have a well thought out plan how to proceed after the end of the project.4) Our main marketing strategy is based on a true passion for mechanics and love for our work.
Our team is constantly engaged in developing of natural innovative models. This project is an extension of what we have achieved till now.
Our team is continuously working on new fascinating ideas for metal models. Current project will broaden and develop further what we have already achieved. With the support of Kickstarter – your support – Time For Machine can cross the borders of one country and offer our models to the world.

story:
The future of emails: always encrypted, decentralized, verified addresses

FlowingMail is an easy to use P2P secure and encrypted email system.

Decentralized: no central server is involved in the transmission of the mail. The mails don't transit through GMail, Yahoo, NSA, etc...

Encrypted: all the messages are always automatically encrypted, without user intervention nor complicated setup operations

Verified: the addresses of the senders and recipients cannot be forged


The most used email systems rely on a central server that receives, stores and forward the messages.

The recent news about PRISM and the closure of Lavabit shown that users cannot rely on such systems for private communications and for an uninterrupted service.

When a central server is involved in the communication then it’s easy to identify the parties that have to be searched, closed down or threatened in order to retrieve the messages that are sent through the network.

The FlowingMail protocol is loosely based on BitTorrent, with some ideas coming from the BitMessage protocol.

The FlowingMail messages are automatically signed and encrypted: only the receiver is able to decrypt the messages.

Messages and public keys are announced using a variant of the Kademlia DHT, while the encrypted emails are transferred in way similar to the BitTorrent fashion.

Check http://flowingmail.com for more information


The team

 

Paolo Brandoli (si.linkedin.com/in/paolobrandoli/)

I’m an Italian, 43 years old C++ software developer.

During the first 13 years of my life I was a weird human being, during the last 30 I was a software developer.

More than 20 years of experience in C++, I wrote code for Windows, OSX, Linux, BSD, OpenSolaris, Android, iOS.

I developed systems that analyze millions of call data records per day from telecommunication equipments, mixed imaging C++/Java libraries for Android, certified metrological and medical systems.

Lately I developed a TCP-IP sniffer (able to intercept, decode, store and retrieve emails, internet pages and VOIP communications) and an encrypted VOIP application for Android & iOS (sold directly to enterprise customers without passing through the app stores, http://digicrypt.info).

I’m the author of the open source project Imebra (DICOM medical imaging file parser/generator)

Mike Vorobyev (si.linkedin.com/pub/mike-vorobiev/11/86a/84b/)

I'm Russian, 39 years old C++ software developer.

More than 13 years of experience in C++, I wrote code for Windows, Linux.

Expert in Windows Internals, large scale financial systems, multithreading.

I worked on real-time gateway data exchange for trading, real-time data stream conversion for financial institutions, systems used by government and big institutions for managing digital signature and long term archiving of digital documents.

One of my latest projects is http://theprecisioninstrument.com ( employees monitoring software )


What We Need & What You Get

Goals

The goals of this project are:

  • beta version of the FlowingMail protocol by December 2013
  • produce a reference API, a series of command line tools that test, validate and use the FlowingMail protocol by February 2013
  • produce a FlowingMail client application for Windows, Linux and Mac by June 2014
  • produce a FlowingMail client application for Android by October 2014
  • play with the FlowingMail protocol and fine tune the clients and continuously improve the protocol
  • install FlowingMail nodes around the world to help the FlowingMail network
  • develop an SMTP to FlowingMail gateway that convert normal emails to FlowingMail & viceversa before they leave your premises.

The ultimate goal is to boost the adoption of FlowingMail as an email protocol, so all the software will be released under an open source license (Apache or BSD license) while the protocol will be in the public domain

Timeline

  • December 2013: beta version of the protocol ready
  • June 2014: Desktop clients ready
  • October 2014: Android client ready
  • December 2014: SMTP to FlowingMail gateway ready

What we need

The 100.000 USD will be spent for:

  • pay full time development for 2 software developers for one year
  • rent for the office and expenses
  • rent for bandwidth and servers around the globe
  • taxes :-(

What if we don’t reach the goal?

Well, plan B is to work on the protocol until we run out of money, then try a new fundraising and hope that the work done will convince more people to donate for the development.

The protocol specifications will be in the public domain to allow anyone to pick up our work and continue the development.


Features of the FlowingMail protocol

Different keys for encryption and signatures

FlowingMail uses two different pairs of RSA private/public keys for encryption and signature. This allow to periodically change the encryption key which will be redistributed automatically to other peers.

Addresses cannot be forged

FlowingMail addresses are a human readable representation of 160 bit hashes (SHA-1) of the public key used to verify the signature. Nodes that announce wrong keys (because the SHA-1 hash is wrong) are banned by other nodes.
The encryption public key can have expiration date and is signed using the signing private key.

Nodes don't need to be always online

Public keys and available mails are always available on the network, even when the recipient node is offline

A variant of the Kademlia DHT stores:

  • the public keys
  • the list of available mails for the recipients
  • the list of nodes that store a specific mail message torrent file
  • the list of nodes that store specific blocks of an email message

Mails are signed by the sender

Mails are signed using the signing RSA private key and encrypted using the recipient RSA encryption public key.

High speed

All the communication between the DHT nodes and the mail transfers happen over UDT protocol (UDP Based Data Transfer), which provides high speed data transfer (with guarantee of delivery) or partial reliability on message delivery.

The transmission of the mails happens in a bittorrent-like fashion: the nodes download the least distributed blocks of the mail from the sender and make it available to the recipient.


Features of the FlowingMail Clients

Desktop

  • written in C++
  • available for Windows, Linux, OSX
  • runs as a service or daemon (runs even when nobody is logged in)
  • can send and receive attachments, pictures, edit and display formatted text
  • rules for organizing the incoming and outgoing messages
  • use NAT-PMP, Internet Gateway Device Protocol, UDP hole punching to forward UDP ports to the NAT device
  • drafts folder
  • search
  • address book
  • automatic update (optional)

Android

  • written in C++ and Java
  • runs as a service (can send/receive even when the application is not open)
  • can send and receive attachments, pictures, edit and display formatted text
  • rules for organizing the incoming and outgoing messages
  • use NAT-PMP, Internet Gateway Device Protocol, UDP hole punching to forward UDP ports to the NAT device
  • drafts folder
  • search
  • address book
  • automatic update (optional)


FAQ

Can I use other BitMessage clients to read the mails?

No: FlowingMail is not compatible with BitMessage.

Can I use BitTorrent clients to read the mails?

No: While FlowingMail takes a lot of concepts from BitTorrent, it is not compatible with BitTorrent

Which language do you use to program the API & the clients?

C++ and C++/Java for Android

What if I turn off my device? Will I receive the mails sent while it was turned off?

Yes, your mails are stored on other peers (encrypted) for up to 7 days. The sender also stores the sent mail and will re-announce it after 7 days if you weren’t able to download it.

Can I send/receive attachments?

You can send anything that you can send in a regular e-mail, including attachments, HTML formatted emails, etc.

How does an user’s address look like?

FM-2D9dmezW8BYTi4EQTy3ncDFJXq2Znkk4mU

Are the mails encrypted?

Yes, the mails are signed and encrypted

When a client boots for the first time then it creates two private/public key pairs: the public keys are distributed to other peers and are used to encrypt the messages and to verify the sender’s signature, while the private keys are kept secret and are used to decrypt the received messages and to sign the outgoing ones.

Why so much time to develop the clients? Once the protocol API is read it should be a walk in the park!

Well...no. When the beta versions of the client get out of the door then the number of users will increase dramatically and the FlowingMail protocol may crack under pressure: in this case some resources must be dedicated to fix the FlowingMail protocol to address the issues.

If the source code is available to everybody, what do the perks offer? Can’t I build the clients by myself from the source code?

Yes, you can build the clients all by yourself from the source code.

The perks allow non-technical users to download the installation packages of the clients and tools, so they don’t need to install compilers, libraries, build and dependency managers, etc...


"They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety, deserve neither liberty nor safety."
Benjamin Franklin

story:
An Introduction to zztat

Hi, I'm Stefan. I'm excited you are reading this and allow me to share this great development with you! Let's release something spectacular together!

Having been active in the Oracle industry for close to 15 years, where it's been both my job and my hobby to understand the Oracle database and how it functions; I am totally fascinated by the Oracle database and its immense depth and vast array of features. 

Here's what others have to say about me:

"I am excited about the possibilities that an open framework like zztat is opening up for changing reactive database administration to a proactive and self-healing system. Stefan has been studying Oracle internals extensively and is the perfect guy to drive a project like this forward." - Bjoern Rost, Oracle ACE Director.

Where complex systems interact, such as is the case with the Oracle database and the applications that run on top of it, unexpected behavior can often be the result. This may be intimidating to administrators, both new and experienced alike. 

In today's fast paced world, where outages can quickly result in financial losses, people are kept awake at night by their pagers and cell phones to ensure systems run stable. I have seen hundreds of different environments throughout my consulting career, and I have witnessed the pressure this type of work can have first hand.

But it doesn't have be this way.

More often than not, people are alerted and pulled out of bed for minor issues. For simple issues that could be avoided entirely. For recurring situations that require nothing but a command or two to resolve. 

Things that can be automated.

And that's why I decided to release this product. 

I'd like you to sleep comfortably. Knowing that your database is in good hands. Log off at night not having to worry about getting called at 3 AM because disk space runs low. Not being paged because someone left his client open and is blocking the nightly batch job. 

I'd like you to have powerful tools at your disposal that make diagnosing issues such as contentions a breeze. You won't have to google around to look for some script of which you are not confident it's safe to run on your production database.

Those are things of the past. 

 

The History

The original idea of zztat (" See-Stat") was born on June 29, 2014, which marked its very first commit on github. It started as a little tool that I wrote myself in order to support a web-application I worked on, which ran on Oracle Standard Edition One: an edition of the Oracle database with limited monitoring functionality. Said application unfortunately had to be abandoned due to Oracle's licensing changes on September 1st, 2015 which made it impossible to fund the immensely increased licensing cost of running the new Oracle Standard Edition 2 as a hobby. This unfortunate turn of events, however, has not stopped the idea of zztat. 

In May 2017 an opportunity presented itself and I decided to work on zztat full-time. I completed the whole framework, added loads more functionality to it and built an array of test cases. And most recently, I started building the wiki to document it all.

And that's where we stand right now.

  • The zztat framework is feature-complete and stable.
  • Basic metrics are in place and supported by gauges and standard reactions.
  • Sophisticated hi-speed sampling for mutexes, latches and session waits is in place.
  • The first add-on for audit data management is complete.
  • Product documentation exists in the form of a wiki; albeit it needs more work to be complete.
  • ... and the entire framework is fully customizable!

What's still needed is a solid range of standard metrics that will ship with zztat by default. And it needs a GUI to be accessible to a wider range of Oracle DBAs. Not everyone likes to type in commands using sql*plus. 

And this is where I need you, potential backers! Running development and sandbox environments costs money. Running massive tests takes a lot of infrastructure and costs money. Software costs money. 

And I'm so close! This is why I have the privilege of asking only for support to see through the beta testing phase and the finishing touches - I don't need to ask people to fund my entire development cycle from start to finish - that's already done and was funded by myself. 

 

This Campaign and The Future

This campaign will deliver the following agenda:

September

The campaign month. It's your opportunity to get zztat at a discounted price, participate in the direction of the final development stage and say "Yes! I'd like to run this in my environment"!

I will continue to work on zztat and provide 2-3 updates each week right here on the campaign page and with way more details over on the zztat blog at https://zztat.net/blog. If reading a technical blog isn't really your cup of tea, you can follow us on Twitter @zztat_oracle or on Facebook at https://fb.me/zztat. The blog as well as the Twitter and Facebook pages have been created specifically for this campaign. 

The main goal for September is getting the beta version released and allow you all to experience this amazing framework hands-on. 

October

When this campaign officially closes, beta testing will begin with each and every backer receiving their own trial license and a copy of the first beta release of zztat. 

What I expect from beta testing is to get valuable feedback from all of you to learn what works and what doesn't work on your particular environment. What default thresholds are too high or too low. What metrics you find useful, and what benefits you the most. 

November

November is the add-on month. As part of the beta testing, it will be decided based on your feedback, which additional add-ons to focus on for release date. 

The following two add-ons will be included in the final release, and are included in the premium package perks - you will be able to use those add-ons for the full year 2018 if you opt for any of the premium perks as part of this campaign.

  • zztat Management GUI Add-on

While zztat is fully functional, writing a few lines of PL/SQL to control it may not be everyone's cup of tea. It needs a GUI to be able to attract a wider audience of users. I have written applications on Oracle's Application Express (APEX) for many years now and it is the perfect choice for zztat due to its native reporting capabilities and interactive nature. APEX will run on the zztat repository database and allow users to control the entire zztat environment from a centralized interface.

This add-on is guaranteed to be included with zztat's release in January 2018.

  • Auditing Add-On

Security and auditing are becoming more and more important in today's industry. This raises a lot of questions on how to manage all that data, and what to do with it. The auditing add-on enables you to automatically collect audit data and analyze it, using the full power of the zztat framework, including automated reactions.

This add-on is guaranteed to be included with zztat's release in January 2018.

 

One of the following add-ons will be chosen by you, the backers, to be included on release date: 

  • Diagnostics & Tuning Pack Add-on

Out of the box, zztat runs on any edition of the Oracle database, be it Standard Edition 1 or 2, or Enterprise Edition. Regardless of which options you have licensed for your database. The Diag & Tuning Pack add-on will include specific metrics and gauges tailored for Enterprise Edition databases that have these packs licensed with Oracle. It will include features such as ASH data mining, AWR data mining and archival to preserve the history.

Ever found out about an issue only to realize the data you needed to diagnose it had already aged out of v$active_session_history? And the archival in dba_hist_active_session_history wasn't precise enough due to it only containing 1/10th of the original data? With this add-on, that will not happen anymore. The data will be available when you need it.

Oracle 12c now has a built-in AWR warehouse feature. But 90% of that data you are likely to never use. With this add-on you can archive just the data you choose, for as long as you need it.

  • Alert log scanner add-on

Automatically monitoring the database alert log from within the database is the key feature of this add-on. Integrated into zztat's framework, zztat will be able to automatically react to specific messages when they are detected in the alert log. Your feedback during beta testing will be invaluable to determine which messages to prioritize and how to best react to them.

It's important to note that this will be a fully intra-database solution - there will be no external operating system processes or jobs of any kind involved. As the rest of zztat itself, it will be pure SQL and PL/SQL.

  • File-based Synchronization add-on

​All data from the target databases as well as internal communication such as metadata synchronization between the repository and the target databases currently happens via a database link. This may not be suitable for some environments, particularly the more security-critical ones. With this add-on, database links are eliminated, and the synchronization is performed through file exchange instead. 

Further add-ons that will be developed after the initial zztat release in Q2-Q4 2018:

  • RAC Support Add-on
  • Data Guard Add-on
  • Cloud Control Plug-in Add-on

December

December is the month to get ready for the release in January. It will be all about polishing the product, squashing any leftover bugs discovered during the beta testing phase, and making sure that you're getting a true Swiss quality software product. 

The final task for December will be to ensure the documentation is 100% complete and documents everything you need to make the most out of zztat. 

January 10th, 2018: Public release!

 

Packages & Licenses

zztat can be licensed in various database packages bundled with one of two available support models: basic and premium support. 

Official zztat Documents

The zztat price list: https://zztat.net/pricelist

The zztat license agreement: https://zztat.net/license

The zztat trial license agreement: https://zztat.net/trial_license 

For the duration of the beta testing phase you will receive a trial license which will expire in January 2018. Backers who purchase a full zztat basic or premium package, will receive a full license agreement in January 2018.

Basic Package

The basic package includes a fully functional copy of zztat with a license that is valid for 1 year, without add-ons. 

If you opt for the basic package you will receive access to technical support:

  • Direct email contact with zztat support via support@zztat.net.
  • A guaranteed response via three business days. Likely to be quicker, but never later.
  • New product versions and patches will be made available to you when they are released.

Premium Package

The premium package includes a fully functional copy of zztat with a license that is valid for 1 year. Additionally, the premium package allows you to customize your zztat installation even further through its various available add-ons. 

If you opt for the premium package you will receive access to technical support:

  • Direct email contact with zztat support via support@zztat.net.
  • Response guaranteed within 24 hours during business days.
  • Priority handling of support requests.
  • At additional charge, zztat installation & configuration on premises, or remotely. Contact us for details. Please note that this is available in a very limited fashion during 2017 as the focus lies on the crowdfunding campaign and getting zztat released.

 

Questions & Answers

The Campaign

Q: Why Crowdfunding?

A: When this project became serious last May I didn't fully anticipate that it would grow to something of this magnitude. But I've had so many ideas that would turn this into the fantastic framework that it is today. And I wanted to deliver the best I possibly could. If you're browsing around on the zztat wiki (www.zztat.net) you will quickly see that the framework is very feature-rich. There's virtually nothing that it can't do in an elegant and integrated fashion.

Now, with 4 months passed I am running low on resources. Crowdfunding hasn't actually occurred to me as a way forward until a friend of mine pointed it out to me. I have come to love the idea and, well, here we are now!

 

Q: Why $15000?

A: This amount of money will be enough to sustain a full-fledged environment for development and testing of the software to get it ready for release. I have been using Amazon's EC2 for many years now and the cost can quickly grow once you start running read and write-intensive workloads. I expect around 30-40% of the money to go into platform costs. 

Advertising will be another large contributor to the total cost to ensure a successful launch. While I have a fairly large network of contacts thanks to many different consulting engagements for many years, having sufficient funding for advertising will ensure a good global reach to make the product known and available to the people that can benefit from it the most. I'd expect around 30% of the money to go into advertising.

The remainder of the funds will cover my personal expenses and ensure that I have internet access, a place to live in and food on the table while I work towards release the following three months.

 

Licensing

Q: Why the basic / premium and add-on based licensing model?

A: I believe that this model provides the most flexible pricing model to ensure that you get access to the functionality you really need. If you are a team of tech-savvy DBAs that rarely touch the mouse, zztat basic is really all you need. This allows such organizations to benefit from an extremely low price compared to other professional monitoring solutions in the market today. 

Other environments may be more focused on different database software and be running MYSQL, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, etc and may have limited Oracle knowledge. For this type of environment, the GUI-based premium package is more suitable. 

Q: Do you offer larger discounted bundles than the 3-and 5-database packages listed here?

A: Yes! If you would like obtain a larger bundle, please do not hesitate to let us know by sending an email to info@zztat.net. We'll be glad to add it to the campaign here, at a discounted rate. For the full zztat retail price list, please visit this URL: http://zztat.net/pricelist.

Any other questions or comments? Please let us know by sending us an email to info@zztat.net!

Thank you! 

 

Stefan
story_txt:
An Introduction to zztatHi, I'm Stefan. I'm excited you are reading this and allow me to share this great development with you! Let's release something spectacular together!Having been active in the Oracle industry for close to 15 years, where it's been both my job and my hobby to understand the Oracle database and how it functions; I am totally fascinated by the Oracle database and its immense depth and vast array of features. Here's what others have to say about me:"I am excited about the possibilities that an open framework like zztat is opening up for changing reactive database administration to a proactive and self-healing system. Stefan has been studying Oracle internals extensively and is the perfect guy to drive a project like this forward." - Bjoern Rost, Oracle ACE Director.Where complex systems interact, such as is the case with the Oracle database and the applications that run on top of it, unexpected behavior can often be the result. This may be intimidating to administrators, both new and experienced alike. In today's fast paced world, where outages can quickly result in financial losses, people are kept awake at night by their pagers and cell phones to ensure systems run stable. I have seen hundreds of different environments throughout my consulting career, and I have witnessed the pressure this type of work can have first hand.But it doesn't have be this way.More often than not, people are alerted and pulled out of bed for minor issues. For simple issues that could be avoided entirely. For recurring situations that require nothing but a command or two to resolve. Things that can be automated.And that's why I decided to release this product. I'd like you to sleep comfortably. Knowing that your database is in good hands. Log off at night not having to worry about getting called at 3 AM because disk space runs low. Not being paged because someone left his client open and is blocking the nightly batch job. I'd like you to have powerful tools at your disposal that make diagnosing issues such as contentions a breeze. You won't have to google around to look for some script of which you are not confident it's safe to run on your production database.Those are things of the past.  The HistoryThe original idea of zztat (" See-Stat") was born on June 29, 2014, which marked its very first commit on github. It started as a little tool that I wrote myself in order to support a web-application I worked on, which ran on Oracle Standard Edition One: an edition of the Oracle database with limited monitoring functionality. Said application unfortunately had to be abandoned due to Oracle's licensing changes on September 1st, 2015 which made it impossible to fund the immensely increased licensing cost of running the new Oracle Standard Edition 2 as a hobby. This unfortunate turn of events, however, has not stopped the idea of zztat. In May 2017 an opportunity presented itself and I decided to work on zztat full-time. I completed the whole framework, added loads more functionality to it and built an array of test cases. And most recently, I started building the wiki to document it all.And that's where we stand right now.
The zztat framework is feature-complete and stable.
Basic metrics are in place and supported by gauges and standard reactions.
Sophisticated hi-speed sampling for mutexes, latches and session waits is in place.
The first add-on for audit data management is complete.
Product documentation exists in the form of a wiki; albeit it needs more work to be complete.
... and the entire framework is fully customizable!
What's still needed is a solid range of standard metrics that will ship with zztat by default. And it needs a GUI to be accessible to a wider range of Oracle DBAs. Not everyone likes to type in commands using sql*plus. And this is where I need you, potential backers! Running development and sandbox environments costs money. Running massive tests takes a lot of infrastructure and costs money. Software costs money. And I'm so close! This is why I have the privilege of asking only for support to see through the beta testing phase and the finishing touches - I don't need to ask people to fund my entire development cycle from start to finish - that's already done and was funded by myself.  This Campaign and The FutureThis campaign will deliver the following agenda:SeptemberThe campaign month. It's your opportunity to get zztat at a discounted price, participate in the direction of the final development stage and say "Yes! I'd like to run this in my environment"!I will continue to work on zztat and provide 2-3 updates each week right here on the campaign page and with way more details over on the zztat blog at https://zztat.net/blog. If reading a technical blog isn't really your cup of tea, you can follow us on Twitter @zztat_oracle or on Facebook at https://fb.me/zztat. The blog as well as the Twitter and Facebook pages have been created specifically for this campaign. The main goal for September is getting the beta version released and allow you all to experience this amazing framework hands-on. OctoberWhen this campaign officially closes, beta testing will begin with each and every backer receiving their own trial license and a copy of the first beta release of zztat. What I expect from beta testing is to get valuable feedback from all of you to learn what works and what doesn't work on your particular environment. What default thresholds are too high or too low. What metrics you find useful, and what benefits you the most. NovemberNovember is the add-on month. As part of the beta testing, it will be decided based on your feedback, which additional add-ons to focus on for release date. The following two add-ons will be included in the final release, and are included in the premium package perks - you will be able to use those add-ons for the full year 2018 if you opt for any of the premium perks as part of this campaign.zztat Management GUI Add-onWhile zztat is fully functional, writing a few lines of PL/SQL to control it may not be everyone's cup of tea. It needs a GUI to be able to attract a wider audience of users. I have written applications on Oracle's Application Express (APEX) for many years now and it is the perfect choice for zztat due to its native reporting capabilities and interactive nature. APEX will run on the zztat repository database and allow users to control the entire zztat environment from a centralized interface.This add-on is guaranteed to be included with zztat's release in January 2018.Auditing Add-OnSecurity and auditing are becoming more and more important in today's industry. This raises a lot of questions on how to manage all that data, and what to do with it. The auditing add-on enables you to automatically collect audit data and analyze it, using the full power of the zztat framework, including automated reactions.This add-on is guaranteed to be included with zztat's release in January 2018. One of the following add-ons will be chosen by you, the backers, to be included on release date: Diagnostics & Tuning Pack Add-onOut of the box, zztat runs on any edition of the Oracle database, be it Standard Edition 1 or 2, or Enterprise Edition. Regardless of which options you have licensed for your database. The Diag & Tuning Pack add-on will include specific metrics and gauges tailored for Enterprise Edition databases that have these packs licensed with Oracle. It will include features such as ASH data mining, AWR data mining and archival to preserve the history.Ever found out about an issue only to realize the data you needed to diagnose it had already aged out of v$active_session_history? And the archival in dba_hist_active_session_history wasn't precise enough due to it only containing 1/10th of the original data? With this add-on, that will not happen anymore. The data will be available when you need it.Oracle 12c now has a built-in AWR warehouse feature. But 90% of that data you are likely to never use. With this add-on you can archive just the data you choose, for as long as you need it.Alert log scanner add-onAutomatically monitoring the database alert log from within the database is the key feature of this add-on. Integrated into zztat's framework, zztat will be able to automatically react to specific messages when they are detected in the alert log. Your feedback during beta testing will be invaluable to determine which messages to prioritize and how to best react to them.It's important to note that this will be a fully intra-database solution - there will be no external operating system processes or jobs of any kind involved. As the rest of zztat itself, it will be pure SQL and PL/SQL.File-based Synchronization add-on​All data from the target databases as well as internal communication such as metadata synchronization between the repository and the target databases currently happens via a database link. This may not be suitable for some environments, particularly the more security-critical ones. With this add-on, database links are eliminated, and the synchronization is performed through file exchange instead. Further add-ons that will be developed after the initial zztat release in Q2-Q4 2018:
RAC Support Add-on
Data Guard Add-on
Cloud Control Plug-in Add-on
DecemberDecember is the month to get ready for the release in January. It will be all about polishing the product, squashing any leftover bugs discovered during the beta testing phase, and making sure that you're getting a true Swiss quality software product. The final task for December will be to ensure the documentation is 100% complete and documents everything you need to make the most out of zztat. January 10th, 2018: Public release! Packages & Licenseszztat can be licensed in various database packages bundled with one of two available support models: basic and premium support. Official zztat DocumentsThe zztat price list: https://zztat.net/pricelistThe zztat license agreement: https://zztat.net/licenseThe zztat trial license agreement: https://zztat.net/trial_license For the duration of the beta testing phase you will receive a trial license which will expire in January 2018. Direct email contact with zztat support via support@zztat.net.
A guaranteed response via three business days. Likely to be quicker, but never later.
New product versions and patches will be made available to you when they are released.
Premium PackageThe premium package includes a fully functional copy of zztat with a license that is valid for 1 year. Additionally, the premium package allows you to customize your zztat installation even further through its various available add-ons. If you opt for the premium package you will receive access to technical support:
Direct email contact with zztat support via support@zztat.net.
Response guaranteed within 24 hours during business days.
Priority handling of support requests.

 Questions & AnswersThe CampaignQ: Why Crowdfunding?A: When this project became serious last May I didn't fully anticipate that it would grow to something of this magnitude. But I've had so many ideas that would turn this into the fantastic framework that it is today. And I wanted to deliver the best I possibly could. I have come to love the idea and, well, here we are now! Q: Why $15000?A: This amount of money will be enough to sustain a full-fledged environment for development and testing of the software to get it ready for release. I expect around 30-40% of the money to go into platform costs. Advertising will be another large contributor to the total cost to ensure a successful launch. While I have a fairly large network of contacts thanks to many different consulting engagements for many years, having sufficient funding for advertising will ensure a good global reach to make the product known and available to the people that can benefit from it the most. I'd expect around 30% of the money to go into advertising.The remainder of the funds will cover my personal expenses and ensure that I have internet access, a place to live in and food on the table while I work towards release the following three months. LicensingQ: Why the basic / premium and add-on based licensing model?A: I believe that this model provides the most flexible pricing model to ensure that you get access to the functionality you really need. For this type of environment, the GUI-based premium package is more suitable. Q: Do you offer larger discounted bundles than the 3-and 5-database packages listed here?A: Yes! If you would like obtain a larger bundle, please do not hesitate to let us know by sending an email to info@zztat.net. We'll be glad to add it to the campaign here, at a discounted rate. Please let us know by sending us an email to info@zztat.net!Thank you!  Stefan

story:
First 500 contributors get a Wootch for just £20/$30!


Wootch is an app enabled security accessory for children, camouflaged as a rechargeable digital watch, which alerts you when your child is more than five metres (16 feet) away from you.

Child Protection Like Never Before!

Powered by QL-Find™ technology, Wootch is an app enabled accessory designed to assist you with child protection like never before!Super Car Blue and Teddy Bear Pink Wootch

Compatible with Bluetooth 4.0 Smartphones/Tablets, Wootch is an app enabled security wrist watch for kids that will alert you when your child is more than five metres (16 feet) away from you, via the supporting QL-Find app.

 

Buddha Tiger Black and White Wootch

Proximity Detection and Locator 

You can extend the maximum distance between the child wearing a Wootch and your Smartphone/Tablet up to 20 metres (65 feet). Perfect for when you are in the park/supermarket/shopping centre to avoid those moments when your child does wander off and panic takes over wondering where your child has gone!

Wootch also has a built-in ‘FindMe’ button your child can press within a 50 metre (164 feet) range. This alerts your Smartphone/Tablet so you are aware your child needs your immediate attention.

Through the QL-Find app you will also be able to establish the last seen location via the Maps application on your Smartphone/Tablet.  

There is also a near/far (similar to hot and cold) gauge you can use to assist you with locating your child.

Device Lock

Wootch also has added security features, such as the ‘Device Lock’. This prevents the Wootch from being turned off without your permission.

The Wootch is also perfect for large families, family day outs and child minders as you can have up to ten Wootchs running from your Smartphone/Tablet. You can also rename each individual Wootch to reflect the name of the child within the QL-Find app.

Bluetooth 4.0

QL-Find is powered using Bluetooth 4.0 technology. The benefit of this is it minimises the battery consumption on both your Bluetooth 4.0 Smartphone/Tablet and your Wootch.

Setting up your Wootch 

Setting up your Wootch is simple.

Compatibility

Wootch is currently compatible with HTC One/One X+, Samsung Galaxy S4/S4 Mini/S3/S3 Mini, iPhone 4S/5, iPad 3/4, iPad Mini, iPod Touch (5th generation).

Community Source Tracking if you happen to loose Bluetooth Connection

We want to build a community of Wootch users, as parents, guardians or child minders. Lets help each other out.

If your Wootch looses Bluetooth connection, it will automaticially get picked up by another wootch user in the same area, our server will automatically send you an update location with the GPS coordinates, data charges will be applicable dependant on your network operator. This is an opt in service.

Where we are at? 

We are approaching the end of development of both the Wootch and accompanying app for iOS devices. At present there is no native Android support for Bluetooth 4.0, so we are developing apps using Samsung and HTC’s own Bluetooth BLE APIs. We will also develop an app for Windows Phone 8 devices once Bluetooth 4.0 support is added (expected with release of Windows Phone 8.1).

Upon receipt of Indiegogo funding we will order the final printed circuits boards and plastics housings, that will be used for the testing required for CE, FCC and Bluetooth certification. We will also develop the Wootch further and make it rechargeable. We feel these are all the elements missing and once added it will meet parents needs. 

CE certification means Wootch complies with all safety & environmental requirements to sell the Wootch within the European market. FCC certification means Wootchs electromagnet interference is within limits required to sell the Wootch in the US market.

We (QL London) attended CES 2013 Las Vegas the initial concept was showcased. We have since developed the software and firmware further to include a digital clock, integrate maps for 'last seen', reduced the minimum range from 10m/32ft  to 5m/16ft and added wireless software updates.

The first version of the app that was used for the CES exhibition is already in the app store, under our previous name NearTooth. A new version of the App, re-branded as QL-Find, will be available updated on iTunes and launched on Google Play. . 

Technical specification 

Wootch uses the latest Bluetooth 4.0 technology to connect to your Smartphone/Tablet. This version of Bluetooth is designed for extreme low power devices to ensure maximum battery life. Dependent on usage, Wootchs battery will last up to one month after each time being fully charged.
*Based on Wootch being switched on and connected to a compatible Smartphone/Tablet for four hours per day.

When the Wootch connects to your compatible Bluetooth 4.0 Smartphone/Tablet it synchronises with the time of your phone, so you don’t need to set the time on the Wootch itself.

Recommendations

We strongly recommend you educate your child on the following;
  • They should not take Wootch off unless they tell you prior to doing so.
  • The panic button which activates the 'FindMe' alert should only be pressed when your child/children requires immediate attention.
  • Your child should remove their Wootch before they go into the bath or shower.

To Recap, QL Wootch;

1) Alerts you via your Bluetooth 4.0 Smartphone/Tablet when your child is approx. more than 5 metres/16ft away*

2) Wootch has a built-in panic alarm that will, when pressed, send a Find Me alerts to your Bluetooth 4.0 Smartphone/Tablet via the QL-Find App within a 50m/164ft range when pressed by your child. When this is pressed by your child it means they require your immediate attention.

3) Wootch also has a built in digital clock to help your child tell the time.

4) Wootch is recommended for children 2-11 years old. 

5) Wootch is rechargeable so you won't have to worry about changing batteries, simply recharge it as you would your Smartphone/Tablet.

Project timeline

  • July 2013: Updated iOS QL-Find app will be available in the App Store.
  • August 2013: Order parts; finish testing for Bluetooth Low Energy mode, FCC and CE certification. Launch first Android app in Google Play for Samsung devices.
  • September 2013: Build production circuit boards & watch case moulds; parts arrive, production begins.
  • October 2013: Order fulfilment begins

FAQ

Can anybody track my child when they are using Wootch?

Wootch is not visible when connected to your Smartphone/ Tablet.

Can I see the QL-Find App now?

Once we receive funding we will be able to finish updating the new version of the QL-Find app and launch on Google Play. We do have the initial version of the app available on iTunes, filled under the previous app name, NearTooth.

Can I use my Wootch on plane?

Unfortunately, use of Bluetooth devices are not permitted on aeroplanes. 

Is the range affected if I am in another room to the Wootch?

The signal strength will be reduced by any physical object between the Smartphone/Tablet and the Wootch.

How long does the battery last?

Dependent on usage, your Wootch battery will last up to one month after each time being fully charged.
*Based on Wootch being switched on and connected to a compatible Smartphone/Tablet for four hours per day. 

Can I control more than one Wootch using the QL-Find app?

Yes, you can control up to ten Wootchs simultaneously. 

Can I connect my Wootch to more than 1 smartphone/tablet?

The Wootch can only be connected to one smartphone/tablet at a time. But you can add your Wootch to multiple devices, so you won't need to re-pair every time you want to use your Wootch with a different device.

Can my child turn off Wootch without me knowing?

No, but only If you have switched on ‘Device Lock’ within the QL-Find app. We recommend you switch on your ‘Device Lock’ when your Wootch is in use.
Please remember to switch off your ‘Device Lock’ before you turn off the Wootch. 

What smartphones/tablets can I use my Wootch with?

We plan to make Wootch compatible with all Smartphones and Tablets that support Bluetooth 4.0. At launch, Wootch will be supported by the following devices: HTC One/One X+, Samsung Galaxy S4/S4 Mini/S3/S3 Mini, iPhone 4S/5, iPad 3/4, iPad Mini, iPod Touch (5th generation).

Does Wootch work indoors as well as outdoors?

Yes it does.

If I have multiple Wootch devices, how can I tell them apart?

We recommend that you rename each Wootch via the QL-Find App as soon as they are paired with your Smartphone/Tablet. You can add up to ten Wootchs per QL-Find App. 

My Wootch won't turn off?

Please check you have turned off your device lock within the QL-Find app.

Is Wootch waterproof?

The Wootch is splash proof not waterproof so please remove before swimming and bath time. We hope to produce a waterproof version in the near future.

Bundle Deals

Exclusively to Indiegogo, we are offering Bundle Deals with our new KeyFob. Like the Wootch, the Keyfob is powered by QL-Find Technology, using the QL-Find App. Simply attach the KeyFob to your keys, laptop case or any other item important to you, and you’ll be alerted as soon as you leave it behind!

We are also offering a Limited Edition Buddha Tiger T-shirt with a contribution of £10 or more. Available in S,M,L,XL.

Feedback

Your feedback is very important to us. If you have any suggestions on how we can improve our product, please let us know;

Facebook.com/qllondon

twitter.com/qllondon

 

Thank you!

The QL Team would like to thank you in advanced for your contribution. We want to give parents extra peace of mind, we believe with Wootch this can be achieved as well as assisting with child protection like never before. We also welcome your feedback and suggestions on how we can further develop Wootch. Simply like us on Facebook and let us know what you think. Thank you for your time and we hope you join us on our exciting journey with the Wootch. Keep watching.

Please Note: Wootch has been designed to assist you with child protection not to supersede your role as a parent. We are using technology that is reliant on constant Bluetooth 4.0 connection that can be lost from and from time to time it can lose connection. We recommend that you check your Bluetooth connection periodically. Parents still need to make sure they are extra vigilant of their child's movements and QL London cannot be held responsible for this.

 

Risks and challenges

The main challenge we have faced has been keeping our production costs as low as possible. Our main objective is to make Wootch at an accessible price point so it is affordable for all parents. With the assistance of Indiegogo patriots, we will be able to achieve the target RRP £29.99.

We wanted to make a product that did not use GPS, as we felt we wanted to alert you prior to your child going missing. We believe this is an affordable price point for a parent/guardians peace of mind. We hope you do too!

We already have working samples of Wootch and know we can deliver on our promise. Majority of the risks we initially had have already been addressed. This project is already 8 months in the making and we are nearly there. With the assistance of Indiegogo patriots, we can complete this project.

 

Update – 2nd August

We’ve been up and running for a few days now, thanks so much for the contributions and support we’ve received! Please do help us spread the word about Wootch. #protectyourchild

PR COVERAGE

 “This is the best thing I have seen in a while and really really needs support.”

 

 “I think that this concept is brilliant.”

"Wootch: Great For People With Wandering Kids."


 

"Wootch is a child locator hidden inside a watch."


 

"Wootch, Child Protection like Never before."


 

If you are contributing from outside the UK please remember to add the shipping cost at checkout. If you’ve contributed already and forgot the shipping cost, don’t panic! We will contact you at the end of the campaign.

Perfect for when you are in the park/supermarket/shopping centre to avoid those moments when your child does wander off and panic takes over wondering where your child has gone!

Wootch also has a built-in ‘FindMe’ button your child can press within a 50 metre (164 feet) range. This alerts your Smartphone/Tablet so you are aware your child needs your immediate attention.
Through the QL-Find app you will also be able to establish the last seen location via the Maps application on your Smartphone/Tablet.  
There is also a near/far (similar to hot and cold) gauge you can use to assist you with locating your child.
Device Lock

Wootch also has added security features, such as the ‘Device Lock’. This prevents the Wootch from being turned off without your permission.
The Wootch is also perfect for large families, family day outs and child minders as you can have up to ten Wootchs running from your Smartphone/Tablet. You can also rename each individual Wootch to reflect the name of the child within the QL-Find app.
Bluetooth 4.0
QL-Find is powered using Bluetooth 4.0 technology. The benefit of this is it minimises the battery consumption on both your Bluetooth 4.0 Smartphone/Tablet and your Wootch.


Setting up your Wootch 
Setting up your Wootch is simple.

Compatibility

Wootch is currently compatible with HTC One/One X+, Samsung Galaxy S4/S4 Mini/S3/S3 Mini, iPhone 4S/5, iPad 3/4, iPad Mini, iPod Touch (5th generation).
Community Source Tracking if you happen to loose Bluetooth Connection
We want to build a community of Wootch users, as parents, guardians or child minders. Lets help each other out.
If your Wootch looses Bluetooth connection, it will automaticially get picked up by another wootch user in the same area, our server will automatically send you an update location with the GPS coordinates, data charges will be applicable dependant on your network operator. This is an opt in service.
Where we are at? 


We are approaching the end of development of both the Wootch and accompanying app for iOS devices. At present there is no native Android support for Bluetooth 4.0, so we are developing apps using Samsung and HTC’s own Bluetooth BLE APIs. We will also develop an app for Windows Phone 8 devices once Bluetooth 4.0 support is added (expected with release of Windows Phone 8.1).
Upon receipt of Indiegogo funding we will order the final printed circuits boards and plastics housings, that will be used for the testing required for CE, FCC and Bluetooth certification. We will also develop the Wootch further and make it rechargeable. We feel these are all the elements missing and once added it will meet parents needs. 
CE certification means Wootch complies with all safety & environmental requirements to sell the Wootch within the European market. FCC certification means Wootchs electromagnet interference is within limits required to sell the Wootch in the US market.
We (QL London) attended CES 2013 Las Vegas the initial concept was showcased. We have since developed the software and firmware further to include a digital clock, integrate maps for 'last seen', reduced the minimum range from 10m/32ft  to 5m/16ft and added wireless software updates.
The first version of the app that was used for the CES exhibition is already in the app store, under our previous name NearTooth. A new version of the App, re-branded as QL-Find, will be available updated on iTunes and launched on Google Play. . 
Technical specification 
Wootch uses the latest Bluetooth 4.0 technology to connect to your Smartphone/Tablet. This version of Bluetooth is designed for extreme low power devices to ensure maximum battery life. Dependent on usage, Wootchs battery will last up to one month after each time being fully charged.*Based on Wootch being switched on and connected to a compatible Smartphone/Tablet for four hours per day.
When the Wootch connects to your compatible Bluetooth 4.0 Smartphone/Tablet it synchronises with the time of your phone, so you don’t need to set the time on the Wootch itself.



Recommendations
We strongly recommend you educate your child on the following; 

They should not take Wootch off unless they tell you prior to doing so.
The panic button which activates the 'FindMe' alert should only be pressed when your child/children requires immediate attention.
Your child should remove their Wootch before they go into the bath or shower.


To Recap, QL Wootch;
1) Alerts you via your Bluetooth 4.0 Smartphone/Tablet when your child is approx. more than 5 metres/16ft away*
2) Wootch has a built-in panic alarm that will, when pressed, send a Find Me alerts to your Bluetooth 4.0 Smartphone/Tablet via the QL-Find App within a 50m/164ft range when pressed by your child. When this is pressed by your child it means they require your immediate attention.
3) Wootch also has a built in digital clock to help your child tell the time.
4) Wootch is recommended for children 2-11 years old. 
5) Wootch is rechargeable so you won't have to worry about changing batteries, simply recharge it as you would your Smartphone/Tablet.
Project timeline




July 2013: Updated iOS QL-Find app will be available in the App Store.

August 2013: Order parts; finish testing for Bluetooth Low Energy mode, FCC and CE certification. Launch first Android app in Google Play for Samsung devices.

September 2013: Build production circuit boards & watch case moulds; parts arrive, production begins.

October 2013: Order fulfilment begins


FAQ
Can anybody track my child when they are using Wootch?
Wootch is not visible when connected to your Smartphone/ Tablet.
Can I see the QL-Find App now?
Once we receive funding we will be able to finish updating the new version of the QL-Find app and launch on Google Play. We do have the initial version of the app available on iTunes, filled under the previous app name, NearTooth.
Can I use my Wootch on plane?
Unfortunately, use of Bluetooth devices are not permitted on aeroplanes. 


Is the range affected if I am in another room to the Wootch?
The signal strength will be reduced by any physical object between the Smartphone/Tablet and the Wootch.
How long does the battery last?
Dependent on usage, your Wootch battery will last up to one month after each time being fully charged.*Based on Wootch being switched on and connected to a compatible Smartphone/Tablet for four hours per day. 
Can I control more than one Wootch using the QL-Find app?
Yes, you can control up to ten Wootchs simultaneously. 
Can I connect my Wootch to more than 1 smartphone/tablet?
The Wootch can only be connected to one smartphone/tablet at a time. But you can add your Wootch to multiple devices, so you won't need to re-pair every time you want to use your Wootch with a different device.
Can my child turn off Wootch without me knowing?
No, but only If you have switched on ‘Device Lock’ within the QL-Find app. We recommend you switch on your ‘Device Lock’ when your Wootch is in use. Please remember to switch off your ‘Device Lock’ before you turn off the Wootch. 
What smartphones/tablets can I use my Wootch with?
We plan to make Wootch compatible with all Smartphones and Tablets that support Bluetooth 4.0. At launch, Wootch will be supported by the following devices: HTC One/One X+, Samsung Galaxy S4/S4 Mini/S3/S3 Mini, iPhone 4S/5, iPad 3/4, iPad Mini, iPod Touch (5th generation).Does Wootch work indoors as well as outdoors?
Yes it does.
If I have multiple Wootch devices, how can I tell them apart?
We recommend that you rename each Wootch via the QL-Find App as soon as they are paired with your Smartphone/Tablet. You can add up to ten Wootchs per QL-Find App. 
My Wootch won't turn off?
Please check you have turned off your device lock within the QL-Find app.
Is Wootch waterproof?
The Wootch is splash proof not waterproof so please remove before swimming and bath time. We hope to produce a waterproof version in the near future.
Bundle Deals
Exclusively to Indiegogo, we are offering Bundle Deals with our new KeyFob. Like the Wootch, the Keyfob is powered by QL-Find Technology, using the QL-Find App. Simply attach the KeyFob to your keys, laptop case or any other item important to you, and you’ll be alerted as soon as you leave it behind!

We are also offering a Limited Edition Buddha Tiger T-shirt with a contribution of £10 or more. Available in S,M,L,XL.

Feedback
Your feedback is very important to us. If you have any suggestions on how we can improve our product, please let us know;


Facebook.com/qllondon
twitter.com/qllondon
 
Thank you!

The QL Team would like to thank you in advanced for your contribution. We want to give parents extra peace of mind, we believe with Wootch this can be achieved as well as assisting with child protection like never before. We also welcome your feedback and suggestions on how we can further develop Wootch. Simply like us on Facebook and let us know what you think. Thank you for your time and we hope you join us on our exciting journey with the Wootch. Keep watching.

Please Note: Wootch has been designed to assist you with child protection not to supersede your role as a parent. We are using technology that is reliant on constant Bluetooth 4.0 connection that can be lost from and from time to time it can lose connection. We recommend that you check your Bluetooth connection periodically. Parents still need to make sure they are extra vigilant of their child's movements and QL London cannot be held responsible for this.
 

Risks and challenges
The main challenge we have faced has been keeping our production costs as low as possible. Our main objective is to make Wootch at an accessible price point so it is affordable for all parents. With the assistance of Indiegogo patriots, we will be able to achieve the target RRP £29.99.
We wanted to make a product that did not use GPS, as we felt we wanted to alert you prior to your child going missing. We believe this is an affordable price point for a parent/guardians peace of mind. We hope you do too!
We already have working samples of Wootch and know we can deliver on our promise. Majority of the risks we initially had have already been addressed. This project is already 8 months in the making and we are nearly there. With the assistance of Indiegogo patriots, we can complete this project.
 
Update – 2nd August
We’ve been up and running for a few days now, thanks so much for the contributions and support we’ve received! Please do help us spread the word about Wootch. #protectyourchild
PR COVERAGE
 “This is the best thing I have seen in a while and really really needs support.”

 
 “I think that this concept is brilliant.”

"Wootch: Great For People With Wandering Kids."

 
"Wootch is a child locator hidden inside a watch."

 
"Wootch, Child Protection like Never before."

 
If you are contributing from outside the UK please remember to add the shipping cost at checkout. If you’ve contributed already and forgot the shipping cost, don’t panic! We will contact you at the end of the campaign.

story:
Please register your email here.

 

https://nanolambda.myshopify.com

 

You will receive a notice as soon as the product is available to purchase. It will be soon.

 

 

 

 

 

This article (EETimes 12/12/2014) would be helpful to begin with.

Tiny Spectrometer Targets IoT



We went to MWC, with apollo, the smallest exhibition item.

 

 

MWC Slide Show

 
 

Applications

Here are some potential applications we learned from many of you.

 



 

Features

 
  • ultra compact ( standard module : 5mm x 5mm x 5mm)
  • cost effective ( target price $10 @ millions volume)
  • nano accurate (+/-1nm) and high resolution ( 5nm~20nm )
  • easy to use and reflowable ( can be soldered directly on PCB )
  • no fiber no moving part
  • wide input angle ( > +/- 30 degree)
  • wavelength coverage : 390nm~760nm, 600nm~1000nm, 400nm~1000nm, 850nm~1050nm ( typically, the narrower range, the higher resolution)
  • flexible wavelength range/resolution customization available
  • UV & IR ranges are not included for this first project but they are certainly on our product roadmap
  • 3.3V single power, low power consumption( < 10mA @max)
  • digital interface to MCU through SPI, GPIO

 

 

How does nano spectrometer work ?

 

 

 

 

 

Where are we in the development ?

  • more than 60 evaluation kits (prototype & engineering sample)  were sold
  • prototype demos at International CES shows in 2010, 2011 and 2012
  • engineering sample demos at TSensors Summit in 2013 and 2014  
  • quick demo video at Youtube (Engineering sample Evaluation kit)

  • mass production sampling will begin in 3Q 2015
  • ADK release will start in March 2015 for innovators to start their own applications development

Your contribution will be used for ADK development and release            (ADK: Application Development Kit)

 

 

Perk for your contribution

For your valuable contribution, you will get the apollo ADK(Application Development Kit) which  helps you to develop your own applications with built-in spectrometer GUI function and Application Program Interface(API) Library  

 

 

    What's included in the ADK

    1. apollo sensor on a controller board which has a USB interface

    • wavelength of your choice : VIS(390nm~760nm), NIR1(600nm~1000nm), FULL(400nm~1000nm), NIR2(850nm~1050nm)

    2. Reference design document

     

    • schematic, timing, register control, parts list, PCB layout

    • module physical dimension

    3. stand-alone Qt-based GUI

    • provides a quick way to get familiar with apollo sensor
    • provides a visualized spectral graph
    • provides controls of the sensor

    4. API(Application Program Interface)

    • available for both 32/64-bit versions of Linux (Ubuntu) and Windows (XP/7/8) 

    5. Example Codes

    • for various development environments  including MATLAB, Visual Studio(for Windows), and Netbeans(for Linux)

     

    Demo showing apollo software running on Linux on BBB(Beagle Bone Black). For software engineers only


     



     

    Type of Perk you will get for your contribution

     

     

     

    *The above prices are only for this campaign.
       Before this campaign, the average price of Evaluation Kits was $3800.

     

    Team : Think Big Start Nano

    Team nanoLambda is indeed a very lean  start-up with handful of passionate engineers in Korea, Taiwan and US. We are very global from the beginning, collaborating with potential customers and partners across the world. We are also lucky that our technology development efforts have been strongly supported by world top class partners, prestigious angels and governments as well. 

     

     

    Business Model : B2B2C or Co-Creation

    Our basic business model is to provide the sensor module and API SW. But we understand it sometimes would become more like B2B2C to co-create the new products and services  based on our disruptive spectral sensing technologies. We are open and flexible for different types of collaborations as much as we can. We  also encourage you to collaborate with other contributors. The related fields are wide and deep.

     

    Your Opportunities: Exponential

    We believe the opportunities are exponential and unlimited. It is untouched and maybe unknown too. Your imagination, creativity, collaboration and smart implementation will change the world. We are excited to initiate, and to be a small part of, this new opportunity.

     

     

     

     

    Risks & Challenges

     

      Schedule Delay

      We understand the delivery delay is the most common problem of crowdfunding in technology sector due to many unexpected technical issues and manufacturing issues.

      To avoid this problem, at least to our campaign contributors, we postponed our campaign start itself. (original plan was to start this campaign in May/June  2014)

      Now we start this campaign because we have the 1st set of modules under the performance test, and the next wafers and module parts are in the pipeline.

       

       

      Update: Mar 21, 2015

      ADK's were assembled.  Sensors are on board, ready for final test.

       

      Update: Mar 31, 2015

      ADK's were shipped for March delivery.



      We will do our best to avoid the delay and to expedite the delivery. In case there is any delivery schedule difference within the same perk, the delivery will be in the order of the contribution made.

         

        Performance may not meet the specification or requirement for your application

          By solving earlier issues, making breakthroughs and platform changes, we have improved the performance a lot this time. But still we don't think the first ADK would satisfy all your needs or expectations. Therefore your feedback and suggestions are very important for us to continue the improvement to satisfy your needs. That's how we make progresses together for previously unknown applications.

           

            FAQ

              Crowdfunding

              • This campaign is not offering equity or shares ( not an investment)
              • Contributing to a campaign and claiming a perk on Indiegogo is not the same as buying something online.
              •  Contributors receive a perk in exchange for their contribution.
              • The nature of crowdfunding is such that campaigns on Indiegogo are raising funds for work-in-progress projects, ideas, or causes.

               

               

              How to contribute to campaign and receive a perk

              STEP1: Pick(click) the perk you like to get

              STEP2: You need to enter shipping address

              STEP3: Payment using credit card or Apple pay.

              STEP4: The PERK item will be delivered on the estimated delivery date

               

              Shipping costs

              It is included for standard EMS( international postal Express Mail Service) or standard courier services. ADK will be shipped from Daejeon Korea.

               

              When is the sensor itself available to purchase?

              Sensor samples will be available from August 2015.

               

              When is the IR range product available?

              It is on our road map. For IR ranges, it is required to use different materials. We have been discussing with our partners toward this direction. We plan to have a very first prototype by the end of this year. At the same time, IR ranges are very wide. Your inputs for the specific needs for specific ranges would help us to narrow down the first target.

               

               



               

              Reference Documents

              ADK Preliminary Brochure (one page)

              apollo Preliminary Spec (one page)

              Introduction Slide: TSensors Summit Tokyo Dec. 2014

               

               

              Any Other Questions?

               

              If you have any general questions, please post a comment on this campaign.

              If you have confidential/private questions, please post your comment as a private. There is a private option button.

               

              Thank You for Your Support !
